Listing thumbnail features:
• A Time Capsule Example

• Well Optioned From the Factory

• Minor Period-Correct Dinan Upgrades
Highlights:
• A Time Capsule Example

‍

• Well Optioned From the Factory

‍

• Minor Period-Correct Dinan Upgrades
Overview:
This 1999 BMW M3 Coupe is finished in Titanium Silver over a black leather interior. Showing 21,655 miles, this car is in very good overall condition and has remained largely stock over the past 25 years. Fitted with a few select Dinan upgrades and clear corner lights, this E36 is the ultimate time capsule that takes you back to the late 1990s. The BMW M-Contour wheels that are fitted to this example were the wheels fitted to the majority of late-production E36 M3s and are in very good condition around the car. 

‍

On the interior, the Vader seats are wrapped in black leather as is the optional center armrest. Owing to that aforementioned time capsule-like quality, basically nothing on the interior has been changed from stock, retaining the original BMW AM/FM Cassette deck with a factory optional 6-CD changer in the trunk. Additionally, the car is fitted with heated front seats and the period-appropriate 3-spoke steering wheel with M-Color stitching. 

‍

Powering the E36 M3 is BMW’s S52- a unique powerplant only installed in these cars for the US and Canadian markets. Although frequently cited as “not a real M engine” due to the lack of individual throttle bodies, and a list of bespoke parts, these engines are notoriously stout and require minimal specialized maintenance to keep on the road. Producing 240 horsepower and 236 lb-ft of torque, the US market E36 M3 was down on power over the European model, but performance between the two cars in the real world is nearly identical. This engine is then connected to a 5-speed manual gearbox that sends power through a limited slip differential to the rear wheels. This example is fitted with a CARB-Legal Dinan High Flow Cold Air Intake along with the proper engine performance software and Dinan strut brace under the hood- neither of these dramatically alter how the car drives but the intake makes it sound great and the strut tower brace definitely ties things together. 

‍

With less than 22,000 miles on the odometer, this car is a true unicorn. The mileage on this car puts it in a real sweet spot where it is nearly flawless, yet you can still drive it some and enjoy the feeling of being behind the wheel of an essentially new car- without driving the value out of it.
History:
This E36 comes to us from a long-time client and dear friend. It was acquired by them in 2020 when it had 20,630 miles. At that time we reset the baseline with services that include our full fluid and filter service, a full cooling system overhaul including belts and fan clutch, power steering intake line, and new Michelin 4S tires. Since that service it's been maintained and serviced at the dealer with it always receiving a need nothing report and a crowd of impressed technicians.

We are thrilled to now have this in our inventory and will be performing an additional final check prior to the vehicle going to its new home to ensure it's ready to be enjoyed.

Listing thumbnail features:
• Low mileage enthusiast owned Roadster from Florida

• Equipped with Genuine BMW hardtop! 

• Iconic and era defining Dakar Yellow rarely seen on the E36/7 chassis
Highlights:
• Low mileage enthusiast owned Roadster from Florida

‍

• Equipped with Genuine BMW hardtop! 

‍

• Iconic and era defining Dakar Yellow rarely seen on the E36/7 chassis

‍
Overview: The Z3M pulls at the heart strings of many and once you drive one it's easy to understand. You sit right above the rear axle and in front of you is the powertrain also found in the M3 of its era. In this case that's the S52 240hp inline-six that propels this platform effortlessly throughout town and backroads alike with low-end toque that you ride like a wave to redline. The quick ratio steering provides feedback you'd expect from the analog era and is always communicating with you. True analog gauges also greet you when absorbing this unique to chassis interior. It's always an experience and in Roadster form with the option to do it with the top down.
History:
This example started its life in PA where it was garage kept and responsibly maintained only traveling 15k miles in 7 years. It then began its journey in Florida with an enthusiast who also drove it sparingly for 12 years and we then acquired it from its last owner who enjoyed it for 4 years before giving us the opportunity to purchase. The condition of the exterior and interior clearly shows it was always stored inside with supple leather and colors being as vibrant as they were when displayed on the delivering dealer's showroom.

EAG completed its Comprehensive Inspection and will be performing several proactive services to ensure this will arrive to its new owner turn-key and ready to be enjoyed. These services include fresh oil service and brake fluid flush, 5th gear detent service along with selector shaft reseal, front driveshaft flex disc (Guibo) replacement, clutch pedal replacement with new bushings, engine drive belts, soft-top creaser cord replacement, glovebox reinforcement, and all of the EAG Extra Mile services we're known for and apply to all of our vehicles.

Listing thumbnail features:
‍• S54 powered LSB M Roadster! 

‍• Rare factory colored hardtop and speedster accessory

• Robust service history with over 12k invested into its preservation
Highlights:
‍• S54 powered LSB M Roadster! 

‍

• Rare factory colored hardtop and speedster accessory

‍

• Robust service history with over 12k invested into its preservation

‍
Overview:
The late model Z3M Roadster, equipped with all the conceivable accessories, finished in legendary LSB! When the Z3 was introduced it almost immediately started a cult like following and after you experience what the Z platform offers it's easy to understand. The driver's seat feels like home with you positioned above the rear wheels while a BMW Motorsport powerplant resides under the long and iconic clamshell hood. In this example it certainly is a pearl with the 3.2L S54 engine sending 315hp to the rear of the car. Speak to any enthusiast that's piloted this configuration and you'll get a greater appreciation of the saying, "Flying by the seat of your pants"! 

‍

While this platform is undoubtly BMW it also bestows unique traits only found in the Z model range. Be it the bespoke seats, auxiliary analog gauges, or center console you feel familiar but with a tinge of additional excitement!
History:
This Heritage EAG M Roadster has over 17k of investment to ensure its preservation! It first arrived at our facility in 2014 with 28,441 miles where it received a full fluid and filter service, fresh Michelin tires, new soft top window, engine drive belts, battery, and a host of extra mile services. Now, in 2025, it received another EAG comprehensive inspection and is receiving several services to reset the baseline. These services include complete low mileage factory Inspection II service, timing chain tensioner seal replacement, constant pressure valve o-ring replacement, replacement fuel level sensor/pump assembly, set of fresh Michelin 4S tires, four wheel alignment and another round of extra mile services to not just mimic but enhance what delivery day was like back in 2001! 

‍

Overview: Absolutely Stunning, Stock E39 M5! ONLY 11,837 miles! Nicely Optioned from BMW including Nappa Leather, M Sport Front Seats, Titan Interior Trim, MKIV DVD Navigation System, M-Audio with Enhanced Bass, Split-Folding Rear Seats, Power Rear Sunshade with Manual Door Blinds, Alcantara Headliner, Homelink Garage Door Opener, Cold Weather Package with Heated Front Seats + Headlight Cleaning System, Xenon Headlights with Angel Eyes and Lip Spoiler. 100% stock condition with the exception of Black Euro Interior Trim. This M5 is in spectacular condition! The exterior finish is all original paint with no significant imperfections or flaws. The interior is well-kept with supple leather, clean carpets + trim with no visible wear marks or issues. This car has resided in California and Florida since new. Always kept in a climate controlled garage, therefore, never seen inclement weather or spent a night outside. The body + undercarriage are spotless with no complaints.
History:
During our first Rejuvenation in 2016, EAG invested over $7,000 into this example ensuring this special car was always turn-key ready for the second owner to enjoy! Service Highlights Included a Complete 10-year Service which includes: Engine Oil + Filter Change, Transmission Fluid Change, Differential Fluid Change, Coolant Flush, Brake Fluid Flush, Power Steering Fluid Flush, Engine Air Filter and Fuel Filter Replacement. Additional Services Include: valve cover gasket replacement, proactive rear door vapor barriers, instrument cluster repair by VDO to correct dead pixels, and reconditioned auto-dim rear-view mirror. EAG will be completing a second comprehensive inspection and rejuvenation ensuring the car is delivered once again in EAGs Next-To-New Condition. This special car is fully sorted and would make a nice addition to any collection or will be an awesome low-annual mileage driver!

We know the importance of delivering what BMW ///M envisioned as a final product no matter the years separated from production, so we go the Extra Mile to make sure the next owner has the opportunity to indulge.

Nicely Equipped from BMW including Widescreen MKIII CD Navigation System, Burlwood Interior Trim, Alcantara Headliner, Homelink Garage Door Opener, Cold Weather Package with Heated Front Seats + Headlight Cleaning System, Xenon Headlights with Angel Eyes and Rear Lip Spoiler Delete. This M5 is in spectacular condition! The exterior is all original paint and has an awesome finish with no notable imperfections or flaws. The interior is well-preserved with supple leather upholstery that still has the original matte finish with no wear areas or issues. This M5 has been garage-kept in North Carolina until 2013, then transported to the 2nd owner in Texas, and then sold by us in 2016 to a wonderful couple that speak and respect the BMW preservation language. Sparingly driven only during nice weather; never seen inclement weather. The body + undercarriage are virtually spotless! Mechanically, this car has had proper care and maintenance with many fluid flushes + oil changes. All service history since new including 1,200 mile break-in service! Service Highlights include a Complete 10-year Service with Engine Oil + Filter Change, Transmission Fluid Change, Differential Fluid Change, Coolant Flush, Brake Fluid Flush, Power Steering Fluid Flush, Engine Air Filter + Fuel Filter Replacement and New Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires in 2016 when the vehicle had 8,619 miles. This year, in 2024, we completed a second round of rejuvenation that includes another full EAG 10-year fluid and filter service, passenger side valve cover gasket replace, DME repair along with new plugs and two new coils, rear sway bar bushings, proactive starter replacement based on current behavior, the infamous E39 seat twist repair, and several EAG Extra Mile items that bring this incredible example to as new as possible condition considering its 22 years of time since leaving BMW's factory. This example is turn-key and ready to be enjoyed by the next caretaker ready to experience the E39 M5 in factory form. Please reach out to learn more and receive additional photos including undercarriage and comprehensive condition related photos.

Listing thumbnail features:
• Outstanding Reference Grade Example

• Two-Time EAG Visitor

• One of The Best Examples We've Seen
Highlights:
• Outstanding Reference Grade Example

‍

• Two-Time EAG Visitor

‍

• One of The Best Examples of One of The Greatest Ever Sport Sedans
Overview:
This 2002 M5 is what could be considered a “reference grade” example, showing just 10,775 miles at the time of cataloging. Finished in Titanium Silver, this M5 is on its second trip through the EAG workshop and needless to say, it hasn’t needed a whole lot of work from our team. This car was delivered new to Leith BMW of Raleigh, NC, and includes records dating back to the first oil change at 1,200 miles. From the factory, this M5 was optioned with a deletion of the decklid spoiler, giving it a much cleaner look. 

‍

On the inside, the car was optioned with the “Luxury” interior package in black Nappa leather. The Luxury interior features elegant vertical stitching on the seat centers and burl wood trim throughout. Black leather extends onto the dash upper and lower, and the center console. As a later M5, this car is fitted with the more attractive slim 3-spoke steering wheel with the M-color stitching, and the later wide-screen MMI system. 

‍

Powering the E39 M5 is a DOHC 5-liter V8 known internally as the S62. It is fitted with double VANOS variable valve timing, eight individual throttle bodies, and “semi-dry-sump” oiling, increasing engine lubrication under hard cornering. Rated from the factory at 394 horsepower and 369 lb-ft of torque, the S62 is an outstandingly flexible engine that will happily pull from 1,800 rpm in top gear or rev to 7,000 rpm. This engine is then backed up by a mandatory 6-speed manual gearbox built by Getrag that sends power back to a shortened 3.15 rear axle with a limited-slip differential. 

‍

At EAG, we think that the E39 M5 may be the ultimate sport sedan of all time. Although BMW has built some cars that are faster, more nimble and more luxurious inside, there was something about this car that made everything just gel perfectly.
History:
Mechanically, this car has had proper care and maintenance with many fluid flushes + oil changes. All service history since new including 1,200 mile break-in service! Service Highlights include a Complete 10-year Service with Engine Oil + Filter Change, Transmission Fluid Change, Differential Fluid Change, Coolant Flush, Brake Fluid Flush, Power Steering Fluid Flush, Engine Air Filter + Fuel Filter Replacement and New Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires in 2016 when the vehicle had 8,619 miles. This year, in 2024, we completed a second round of rejuvenation that includes another full EAG 10-year fluid and filter service, passenger side valve cover gasket replace, DME repair along with new plugs and two new coils, rear sway bar bushings, proactive starter replacement, the infamous E39 seat twist repair, and several EAG Extra Mile items that bring this incredible example to as new as possible condition considering its 22 years of time since leaving BMW's factory.

This example is turn-key and ready to be enjoyed by the next caretaker ready to experience the E39 M5 in factory form. Please reach out to learn more and receive additional photos including undercarriage and comprehensive condition related photos.

Listing thumbnail features:
• EAG Signature E39 M5! 

• Rare Imola/Silverstone color combination

• Less than 10k miles with EAG services dating back to 2017
Highlights:
• EAG Signature E39 M5! 

‍

• Rare Imola/Silverstone color combination

‍

• Less than 10k miles with EAG services dating back to 2013

‍
Overview:
The E39 M5 chassis is turning 25 years old this year, and even today, it remains the sports sedan that every modern sedan is measured against. That is just one of the many reasons that we at EAG are fans of this chassis, we always try to find great examples, and this one is, without a shadow of a doubt, one of the best anywhere. In an era where BMW’s slogan was “The Ultimate Driving Machine,” the E39 M5 seems tailor-made to fit that phrase.

‍

There is significant debate among enthusiasts about what the best color is on the E39 - some say LeMans Blue, while others prefer the clean look of Alpine White. But what can't be denied is that when you see an Imola Red example that has been well taken care of - it is just drop dead gorgeous. As a non-metallic shade, this medium red gives the E39 M5 a timeless look and works very well with the black plastic rub-strips around the car as an accent. At EAG, we ensure that before a car leaves our dealership, everything is basically as it would have been coming out of the factory - needless to say, on this M5 with just 9,557 miles, the exterior didn't need much of anything from us.

‍

On the inside, the original buyer ordered a two-tone Sport interior in black and Silverstone leather which is a perfect combination with the extroverted Imola exterior. With aluminum trim around the cabin, this 2002 is a post-LCI car, meaning it is fitted with the more attractive 3-spoke steering wheel, and widescreen navigation display in the center stack.

‍

Powering the E39 M5 is a DOHC 5-liter V8 known internally as the S62. It is fitted with double VANOS variable valve timing, eight individual throttle bodies, and “semi-dry-sump” oiling, increasing engine lubrication under hard cornering. Rated from the factory at 394 horsepower and 369 lb-ft of torque, the S62 is an outstandingly flexible engine that will happily pull from 1,800 rpm in top gear or rev to 7,000 rpm. This engine is then backed up by a mandatory 6-speed manual gearbox built by Getrag that sends power back to a shortened 3.15 rear axle with a limited-slip differential.
History:
‍

EAG first had the honor of getting to know this special M5 back in 2013 when it had only 3,933 miles! At that time we performed our EAG 10 year fluid and filter service along with the famous E39 instrument cluster pixel repair. It spent the next 5 years and 5k miles with an enthusiast collector who properly maintained the vehicle and sold it back to us knowing we wanted to continue to be a part of this vehicle's history. When it returned in 2018 we updated several suspension components due to age including the front thrust arm bushings, rear upper control arms, and rear sway bar brackets. This was coupled an oil service and anything else we could do to make this as perfect as possible. We once again received the vehicle back in 2023 and did all fluids once again based on time along with proactive services like headlight adjusters, new Michelin tires, and all EAG extra mile services.

‍

This is now an EAG Signature M5 and will receive another round of services to ensure it is fully turn-key and ready to be enjoyed for the fourth time providing the like new E39 M5 experience.

When it returned in 2018 we updated several suspension components due to age including the front thrust arm bushings, rear upper control arms, and rear sway bar brackets. This was coupled an oil service and anything else we could do to make this as perfect as possible. We once again received the vehicle back in 2023 and did all fluids once again based on time along with proactive services like headlight adjusters, new Michelin tires, and all EAG extra mile services. ‍ This is now an EAG Signature M5 and will receive another round of services to ensure it is fully turn-key and ready to be enjoyed for the fourth time providing the like new E39 M5 experience.

‍• Incredibly desired LeMans over Carmel color combination

• EAG Signature E39 M5
Highlights:
‍• Incredibly desired LeMans over Carmel color combination

‍

• Only 30k miles traveled since new! 

‍

• EAG Signature E39 M5

‍
Overview:
New Arrival EAG Signature E39 M5 in LeMans over Carmel with only 30k miles! 

‍

The E39 platform is often held as the sweet spot for the super sedan category that BMW introduced back in 1988 for the US. One trip around the block and it's easy to see why that's the sentiment. That is all it takes to picture this vehicle being the one that satisfies the mundane Monday commute and spurs the excitement of the weekend driving adventures. No matter if your introduction to this vehicle's capabilities was via Madonna sliding around or hearing an executive stretching its legs on an on-ramp there aura of something special was a real feeling and it's only grown with time.

‍

This facelifted example has an extensive history with EAG and its network of enthusiasts. It's because of this history we proudly present it as an EAG Signature M5. The exterior shows free from any blemishes and the interior retains a vibrant appearance but with the to be expected matte finish. Always cared for with the best products and procedures this M5 allows the opportunity to experience BMW M at its best only separated by time.
History:
EAG first had the opportunity to indulge in this M5 in 2016 when it arrived with only 27k miles. We reset the baseline from a service standpoint by performing an early BMW Inspection II service, engine belt replacement due to age, thrust arm bushings were upgraded to the E53 unit, the clutch was proactively replaced with an upgraded OEM unit, upper control arms replaced to remedy the aging of ball joint boots, axle seals replaced proactively, and rear door vapor barriers replaced proactively to ensure the Carmel panels were not compromised. We then had the car back in our service facility in 2021 where it received another $5,000 worth of maintenance and E39 specific upgrades like headlight adjusters, seat twist repairs, and DME update.

‍

Now in 2025 we're performing another inspection and all subsequent services required to ensure this signature M5 arrives to its new owner ready to be enjoyed! 

‍

Listing thumbnail features:
‍• Single Ownership Until 2025

• Desirable Sport Interior

• Exceptional Low Mileage Example
Highlights:
‍• Single Ownership With Just 13,940 Miles!

‍

• Desirable Sport Interior With Single-Tone Black Leather

‍

• Collector-Grade Example of One of Our Favorite M Cars
Overview:
At EAG, we love to find low-mile, factory fresh examples of BMW M’s best cars. There is something special about getting into a car that is more than 20 years old, and has fewer miles than most original owners put on in their first year of ownership. We can rejuvenate a BMW better than pretty much anyone out there, but a well cared for, exceptionally low mile car just has some extra X-factor that can’t be replicated. 

‍

This 2002 BMW E39 M5 is one of those cars, under the care of a single owner until February 2025, the car shows just 13,940 miles at the time of cataloging. Finished in Jet Black over a black extended leather “Sport” interior, the car is positively immaculate and one of the finest examples of what is without a doubt, one of BMW’s best cars. Sold through Thompson BMW East of Doylestown, PA, the car was exclusively serviced at BMW main dealers, and was sold to Virginia in February 2025. As you would expect, the car is in exceptional condition throughout and looks about as you would expect an M5 to look fresh off the showroom floor. 

‍

The interior is the sought-after Sport interior, with extended black leather featuring “ostrich” seat centers. Along with the different seat upholstery, the car has aluminum trim throughout the cabin which gives a more modern, timeless look than the wood alternative. As a 2002, this car benefits from the updated 3-spoke steering wheel and wider infotainment screen.

‍

Powering this M5 is BMW’s famed S62 V8. With 4.9-liters of displacement, dual overhead cams with VANOS on the intake and exhaust, as well as individual throttle bodies, the engine was rated from the factory at 394 horsepower and 369 Lb-Ft of torque. This engine is renowned for its flexibility and ability to make power throughout the rev range - just as willing to idle around in traffic as it is winding out to redline on the track. This power is then sent through a 6-speed Getrag manual gearbox to the rear wheels.

‍
History: This car has recieved comprehensive servicing throughout its life and will receive an additional full inspection with subsequent work at EAG to ensure it's a turn-key example ready for its new owner!

Listing thumbnail features:
• One of BMW's Greatest Designs

• 2 Owners From New

• Includes Original Window Sticker
Highlights:
• One of BMW's Greatest Designs

‍

• 2 Owners From New

‍

• Includes Original Window Sitcker

‍
Overview:
This 2002 BMW Z8 was sold new at Ralph Schomp BMW in Littleton, CO and stayed with its original owner until 2021, at which point it passed into the consignor’s possession. Finished in Titanium Silver Metallic over an all Black Nappa leather interior, the car shows just 24,023 miles at the time of cataloging and remains in exceptional stock condition. The Z8’s exterior is one of the most beautiful designs to ever come out of BMW and looks particularly good on this car, given the removable hardtop, which is affixed. Standing as the Halo car for BMW at a time when they were producing arguably the best lineup of cars across the board in the brand’s history, it is no wonder that the Z8 never really depreciated from its original price and good examples like this have been rapidly on the rise in recent years. 

‍

Black Nappa leather covers the seats, door cards, center console and lower dash on this example, which appears largely untouched. The Z8’s interior leans in on the retro-modern aesthetic of the day, with its centrally-mounted gauge cluster and sweeping central dash that is color-matched to the car’s exterior. The steering wheel is another throwback design with a round central hub and four metal tines making up each of the three spokes. The only modification to the interior is the addition of a ZHP shift knob, doing away with the overly-lightweight plastic unit that came on the car, and adding some nice heft to the shifting. 

‍

Powering the Z8 is the much-loved S62 V8 out of the E39 M5. Displacing 4.9 liters, this V8 produces 395 horsepower and 359 lb-ft of torque, which was quick in the M5 but makes the 500lb lighter Z8 particularly sprightly. Contemporary road tests were able to run 0-60 times in the low 4-second range, and the top speed is electronically limited to 155 mph. All of BMW’s Z8s were fitted with the same 6-speed manual gearbox found in the E39 M5 which offers a pleasant shift feel thanks to a UUC short-shift kit and the ZHP shift knob on top. Additionally, an Eisenmann exhaust has been fitted to open up that beautiful sounding V8 which is extra nice when the top is down!

‍

From the day the Z8 came out in 1998, pretty much everybody agreed it was an instant classic. This is a very high quality example of the model and would be the perfect addition to any collection. 

‍
History: As you would expect from any car at EAG, when this vehicle arrived to us, we set to work seeing what needed to be addressed. We started by doing our standard checks on the S62 V8 to make sure that was in order, at which point, a rear main seal leak was detected. This is almost a given on cars of this age and we end up doing a lot of them - and while you're in there, might as well swap out the clutch too, which we did. The EAG Extra Mile service replaced fading badges, rubber trim, clips and gaskets around the car, and an alignment was carried out as well. The result is a car that feels like the day it rolled out of the showroom and is ready for its next owner to enjoy.

Listing thumbnail features:
‍• Desirable Alpine White finish with only 8,766 miles from new! 

• 100% stock and always enthusiast owned with service history

• One of the nicest M Coupes available in the country
Highlights:
‍• Desirable Alpine White finish with only 8,766 miles from new! 

‍

• 100% stock and always enthusiast owned with service history

‍

• One of the nicest M Coupes available in the country

‍
Overview:
The BMW M Coupe instantly became a cult upon its release to the market. Dubbed the "Clown Shoe" because of its completely unique shape compared to BMW's line up but we also think it's because of the smile it induced when sitting behind the wheel. This example is finished in the highly desirable Alpine White with the Black/Grey interior combination. It's traveled less than 9k miles since new and always maintained! Originally sold to an enthusiast in Arkansas it never saw any inclement weather and always garage kept until 2019 when it was sold to its second owner in Arizona. It traveled 800 miles in two years and finally found its new home at EAG in 2021!

‍

Equipped with the legendary S54 powerplant mated to a five-speed manual transmission this vehicle embodies an end of an era while properly speeding into the golden age of analog M cars. This vehicle will not disappoint the pickiest of M Coupe collectors and offers the pure experience BMW M engineers intended on providing 23 years ago.
History:
EAG originally acquired this special M Coupe back in 2021 and performed several services to ensure maintenance was up to date and the vehicle needed nothing to be enjoyed. These services include a valve adjust along with a full fluid and filter service, brake pressure sensors replaced during its brake fluid flush, and all of the extra mile services. This example comes with service history and documentation dating back to its initial ///M break-in service performed in June of 2002. We will be performing an additional in-depth inspection prior to the sale of the vehicle and addressing all of its service needs while documenting it in order to add to the vehicle's already sterling provonance.

‍

• Late Production Example

• Great Color Combination w/Sport Interior

• A Perfect Driver Example of the Quintessential Sports Sedan

‍

‍
Highlights:
• Late Production Example

‍

• Great Color Combination w/Sport Interior

‍

• A Perfect Driver Example of the Quintessential Sports Sedan

‍
Overview:
This E39 M5 is one of the final M5s of this generation produced, with an April 2003 build date, and production of the model ending in June of that year. Finished in Carbon Black, this wonderful example shows 73,248 miles at the time of cataloging and is on its second trip through our workshop. Sold new in Southern California, this car was in the greater Los Angeles area until 2006, when it was sold to Washington state, where it lived until coming to us in 2011. Since then, the car has been under the care of a single owner, who has enjoyed and cared for the car in Michigan. 

‍

The car is largely unmodified aside from an upgraded Hizpo head that looks very close to the factory unit but has both Android Auto and a Can Bus Decoder system. This car was fitted with the Sport interior option in black leather. This means that the seats have imitation ostrich skin Napa leather centers and bruised aluminum dash, door, and center console trim. The overall condition of the interior is very good, and you can tell, looking at the seats, that the previous owners paid attention to not damage the leather or bolsters on the seats. 

‍

Powering the E39 M5 is a DOHC 5-liter V8 known internally as the S62. It is fitted with double VANOS variable valve timing, eight individual throttle bodies, and “semi-dry-sump” oiling, increasing engine lubrication under hard cornering. Rated from the factory at 394 horsepower and 369 lb-ft of torque, the S62 is an outstandingly flexible engine that will happily pull from 1,800 rpm in top gear or rev to 7,000 rpm. This engine is then backed up by a mandatory 6-speed manual gearbox built by Getrag that sends power back to a shortened 3.15 rear axle with a limited-slip differential. 

‍
History:
This Carbon Black over Black example was originally sold by EAG in 2011 when it had 32,886 miles. It's now back with 73,248 miles and completed its mechanical rejuvenation so it's ready for the next 50k miles! This driver's M5 has over $18,000 invested into its mechanical integrity. Services that were completed include the following:-EAG 10 year complete fluid and filter service-valve cover gaskets replaced-Lower oil pan gasket replaced-Transmission output and selector seal replaced-Power steering pump replaced-Power steering cooling line replaced-Front brake calipers replaced-Rear differential output seals replaced-Front struts replaced-Rear toe-adjustment arms replaced-Rear upper control arms replaced-Upgraded rear sway bar brackets installed-Rear sway bar links replaced-Rear window vapor seals resealed-E39 front seat twist repair performed-Headlight adjustment units replaced-Fuel door pocket refinished-Battery replaced-All EAG Extra Mile services completed

‍

Listing thumbnail features:
• A Reference Grade E39 M5

• Desirable Sport Interior Package

• One of The Best E39 M5s We Have Ever Offered
Highlights:
• A Reference Grade E39 M5

‍

• Desirable Sport Interior Package

‍

• One of The Best E39 M5s We Have Ever Offered

‍
Overview:
This 2003 BMW M5 was produced in September 2002 and is finished in one of the E39 M5’s signature colors- Carbon Black Metallic. Showing a scarcely believable 3,355 miles on the odometer, this is about as close as you can get to buying a brand-new E39 M5. This M5 is on its second trip through our facility at EAG, last offered in 2020, at which point it showed 3,156 miles. Cars that have been used so sparingly and kept in such exceptional condition are considered “reference-grade” as they are essentially in as-new condition and are important to keep in such condition for future generations. Needless to say, the exterior is essentially perfect. The only changes of note from factory specification are new Michelin Pilot Sport 4S tires and two color-matched plugs in the front bumper, where it was drilled for a license plate at the original selling dealer. 

‍

The interior of this M5 was ordered with a Sport interior, which fits the car with two-tone seats with “Ostrich” leather centers and aluminum trim throughout the cabin. On this car, a combination of black and “Silverstone” gray leather is fitted on the seats, center console, door cards and steering wheel. As with most leather interiors, most M5s you find for sale at this point- even very nice examples, have lost some of the factory matte finish on the various surfaces around the cabin- but not so on this car. The steering wheel is perfect, with the deviated M color stitching still as vibrant as when the car was new, and none of the plastic has gone the least bit shiny, as happens over time with these vehicles. 

‍

Powering this M5 is the aforementioned S62 V8- a true masterpiece of engineering. The 4.9-liter engine produces 394 horsepower and 369 lb-ft of torque thanks to 8 individual throttle bodies and double VANOS variable valve timing. As the first V8 BMW M car, the E39 offered seamless performance anywhere in the powerband. Whereas some of BMW’s previous M cars required the driver to wring them out to extract real-world performance, the E39 M5 offers effortless speed in any gear, at any revs. The only available gearbox for this M5 was a 6-speed Getrag manual, which sent power to the rear wheels through a limited-slip differential. In period, these M5s were clocked as running from 0-60 mph in 4.8 seconds and on to an electronically limited top speed of 155- although it has been said with the limiter removed, they are easily capable of more than 185 mph. 

‍

The E39 M5 chassis is turning 25 years old this year, and even today, it remains the sports sedan that every modern sedan is measured against. That is just one of the many reasons that we at EAG are fans of this chassis, we always try to find great examples, and this one is, without a shadow of a doubt, one of the best anywhere. In an era where BMW’s slogan was “The Ultimate Driving Machine,” the E39 M5 seems tailor-made to fit that phrase. 

‍
History:
A reference grade example means something that has been owned, serviced, and preserved since new and this hits all of those marks. An incredible spec coupled with history that documents its 1,200 mile BMW ///M break-in service on 08/28/2003. We received this special vehicle in 2020 and have since preserved it for the next owner.

In 2020 when this first arrived we knew we had to reset the baseline so a comprehensive EAG 10-year service was performed that includes all of the fluids and filters being replaced. We also replaced the oil pain solenoid O-rings that commonly will start to leak over time. The rest of the services were also time based so oil filter housing mounts were replaced, rear upper control arms, front sway bar end links, and a new starter motor.

‍

Its current work order followed this line of logic and no expense was spared when seeing how we can future proof this example. Services include a brake fluid flush, lower oil pan gasket, front thrust rod bushings, rear CV joint, and upgrading the rear sway bar brackets with our upgraded examples. This M5 is ready for a collection or cross-country trip.

Listing thumbnail features:
• Three Time EAG Signature Vehicle

• Coveted LCI "Sport" Interior

• Fitted With a Short Shift Kit and ZHP Shift Knob
Highlights:
• Three Time EAG Signature Vehicle

‍

• Coveted LCI "Sport" Interior

‍

• Fitted With a Short Shift Kit and ZHP Shift Knob
Overview:
This 2003 BMW M5 is on its third trip through the shop at EAG and is finished in one of the E39 M5’s signature colors- Carbon Black Metallic. Showing a remarkable 27,625 miles, the car is in absolutely outstanding condition both inside and out. Carbon Black Metallic is a great color on these cars, looking like a normal black in the dark or when it’s overcast, but when the sun comes out, it shows a remarkable blue hue that you would have never known was there otherwise. This is well matched to the Shadow Chrome finish on the wheels - this multi-stage process consists of multiple paint and clearcoat colors, resulting in a unique smoked look that is notoriously difficult to replicate. 

‍

The interior of this M5 was ordered with a Sport interior, which fits the car with black “Ostrich” leather centers and aluminum trim throughout the cabin. Over time, the leather in an E39 can dry out and become cracked and creased - this car makes the effort in preservation clear when you open the door. The seats look essentially perfect and the steering wheel shows essentially zero signs of wear. On the entire car, the only upgrade is the addition of a short shift kit and a later ZHP weighted shift knob. 

‍

Powering this M5 is the aforementioned S62 V8- a true masterpiece of engineering. The 4.9-liter engine produces 394 horsepower and 369 lb-ft of torque thanks to 8 individual throttle bodies and double VANOS variable valve timing. As the first V8 BMW M car, the E39 offered seamless performance anywhere in the powerband. Whereas some of BMW’s previous M cars required the driver to wring them out to extract real-world performance, the E39 M5 offers effortless speed in any gear, at any revs. The only available gearbox for this M5 was a 6-speed Getrag manual, which sent power to the rear wheels through a limited-slip differential.

‍

The E39 M5 chassis is turning 25 years old this year, and even today, it remains the sports sedan that every modern sedan is measured against. That is just one of the many reasons that we at EAG are fans of this chassis; we always try to find great examples like this one. 

‍
History:
EAG initially acquired this M5 from a repeat client and avid BMW enthusiast who owned several E39s in the past. The condition of this example is incredible and among the last seventy built for the illustrious E39 M5 run. The options include MKIV DVD Navigation System, Sport Interior with Titan Interior Trim, M-Audio with Enhanced Bass, Cold Weather Package with Heated Seats + Headlight Cleaning System, Split-Folding Rear Seats, Power Rear Sunshade with Manual Door Blinds, Xenon Headlights with Angel Eyes and Rear Lip Spoiler.

In 2019 EAG completed our Comprehensive Pre-Purchase Inspection and Rejuvenation Work Order verifying the integrity of this M5 Sedan as a turn-key, needs-nothing car. Service Highlights Included a Complete 10-year Service which includes: engine oil + filter change, transmission fluid change, differential fluid change, coolant flush, brake fluid flush, power steering fluid flush, engine air filter and fuel filter replacement. Additional Maintenance Includes: Proactive rear main seal and clutch replacement, rear upper control arms, upgraded EAG billet aluminum rear sway bar brackets, rear-view mirror auto-dim functionality repair and pro-active rear door vapor barriers. A second Rejuvenation Inspection and all services will be completed before delivery to the next Enthusiast. Complete Car with All Keys, Books + Manuals. Clean Vehicle History Report with No Accidents + No Issues.

Listing thumbnail features:
• EAG Signature E39 M5

• Modified with the Enthusiast in mind

• Collector Grade low mileage late model example

‍

‍
Highlights:
• EAG Signature E39 M5

‍

• Modified with the Enthusiast in mind

‍

• Collector Grade low mileage late model example

‍

‍
Overview: When the E39 M5 was unveiled at the 1998 Geneva Motor Show, it represented a sea change for the model and signified the M5’s evolution into a proper Autobahn missel. For the first time in BMW M’s history, the M5 was powered by a motorsport-derived V8 called the S62, which was connected to a 6-speed manual transmission. Although the E39 M5 was only 100 lbs heavier than the outgoing E34, it felt like a far more developed product thanks to its luxurious and thoroughly modern interior accommodations. When the car went on sale in late 1998, it immediately became the default choice for the well-heeled enthusiast looking for the perfect car to drive every day to the office but also take for a rip in the backroads on the weekend.
History:
EAG sourced this last-year of production E39 M5 from the 2nd owner in 2012 when it had 3,485 miles and then placed it with a good friend + multiple EAG owner in Florida who enjoyed the car for 6 months then we purchased the car back with 7,050 miles. In 2013, we placed the vehicle with a collector in New Jersey where he enjoyed the car then shipped it to his home in California. This example is in remarkable condition! The Titanium Silver exterior paint has an awesome finish showing very few cosmetic imperfections or blemishes. The interior is well-preserved with supple leather showing with no wear marks or issues. This example has been well-maintained and has resided in a climate-controlled garage since new. Never driven in winter conditions, therefore, the body and undercarriage are spotless with no rust or beginning signs of corrosion.

Enthusiast driven upgrades have been added during its last ownership that include KW V3 suspension, SuperSprint mid-pipe, Dinan mufflers, and Eventuri intake system to enhance the visceral note all E39 M5 owners know so well!
CarsForSale Description: *EAG Heritage Vehicle - New Arrival* Titanium Silver over Black Extended Leather, Stunning, All Original, Stock E39 M5! Total Garage Queen! Nicely Equipped from BMW including Widescreen MKIII CD Navigation System, Burlwood Interior Trim, Alcantara Headliner, Homelink Garage Door Opener, Cold Weather Package with Heated Front Seats + Headlight Cleaning System, Xenon Headlights with Angel Eyes and Rear Lip Spoiler Delete. This M5 is in spectacular condition! The exterior is all original paint and has an awesome finish with no notable imperfections or flaws. The interior is well-preserved with supple leather upholstery that still has the original matte finish with no wear areas or issues. This M5 has been garage-kept in North Carolina until 2013, then transported to the 2nd owner in Texas, and then sold by us in 2016 to a wonderful couple that speak and respect the BMW preservation language. Sparingly driven only during nice weather; never seen inclement weather. The body + undercarriage are virtually spotless! Mechanically, this car has had proper care and maintenance with many fluid flushes + oil changes. All service history since new including 1,200 mile break-in service! Service Highlights include a Complete 10-year Service with Engine Oil + Filter Change, Transmission Fluid Change, Differential Fluid Change, Coolant Flush, Brake Fluid Flush, Power Steering Fluid Flush, Engine Air Filter + Fuel Filter Replacement and New Michelin Pilot Super Sport tires in 2016 when the vehicle had 8,619 miles. This year, in 2024, we completed a second round of rejuvenation that includes another full EAG 10-year fluid and filter service, passenger side valve cover gasket replace, DME repair along with new plugs and two new coils, rear sway bar bushings, proactive starter replacement based on current behavior, the infamous E39 seat twist repair, and several EAG Extra Mile items that bring this incredible example to as new as possible condition considering its 22 years of time since leaving BMW's factory. This example is turn-key and ready to be enjoyed by the next caretaker ready to experience the E39 M5 in factory form. Please reach out to learn more and receive additional photos including undercarriage and comprehensive condition related photos.

Listing thumbnail features:
• One of the last of the E39 M5's ever produced

• Completely factory stock and optioned nicely from factory

• EAG Heritage M5 with multiple extensive service history
Highlights:
• One of the last of the E39 M5's ever produced

‍

• Completely factory stock and optioned nicely from factory

‍

• EAG Heritage M5 with multiple extensive service history

‍
Overview:
The E39 M5 chassis is turning 25 years old this year, and even today, it remains the sports sedan that every modern sedan is measured against. That is just one of the many reasons that we at EAG are fans of this chassis, we always try to find great examples, and this one is, without a shadow of a doubt, one of the best anywhere. In an era where BMW’s slogan was “The Ultimate Driving Machine,” the E39 M5 seems tailor-made to fit that phrase.

‍

Powering this M5 is the aforementioned S62 V8- a true masterpiece of engineering. The 4.9-liter engine produces 394 horsepower and 369 lb-ft of torque thanks to 8 individual throttle bodies and double VANOS variable valve timing. As the first V8 BMW M car, the E39 offered seamless performance anywhere in the powerband. Whereas some of BMW’s previous M cars required the driver to wring them out to extract real-world performance, the E39 M5 offers effortless speed in any gear, at any revs. The only available gearbox for this M5 was a 6-speed Getrag manual, which sent power to the rear wheels through a limited-slip differential. In period, these M5s were clocked as running from 0-60 mph in 4.8 seconds and on to an electronically limited top speed of 155- although it has been said with the limiter removed, they are easily capable of more than 185 mph.
History:
‍

This EAG Heritage E39 M5 has substantial history with EAG starting in 2017 and service records dating back to when the vehicle was new. This is one of the last 75 M5's ever built and holds a special place in our heart. When we first received this example from Southern California we invested over 12k in services ensuring it was turn-key and needed nothing. These services included full fluid and filter service, water pump and thermostat replacement, oil pan solenoid seal replacement, power steering cooler line replacement, proactive clutch replacement with rear main seal, front thrust arm bushing replacement along with alignment, sway bar bushings were replaced, rear sway bar brackets upgraded, and all of the EAG Extra Mile services to recreate delivery day back in 2003. This will receive another EAG comprehensive inspection and subsequent work order for the new enthusiast owner. We look forward to continue to support this model throughout its next ownership!

These services included full fluid and filter service, water pump and thermostat replacement, oil pan solenoid seal replacement, power steering cooler line replacement, proactive clutch replacement with rear main seal, front thrust arm bushing replacement along with alignment, sway bar bushings were replaced, rear sway bar brackets upgraded, and all of the EAG Extra Mile services to recreate delivery day back in 2003. This will receive another EAG comprehensive inspection and subsequent work order for the new enthusiast owner. We look forward to continue to support this model throughout its next ownership!

Listing thumbnail features:
• EAG Heritage M5 with three visits through our facility

• Service history dating back to when the vehicle was new! 

• Over 15k invested since 2020 to continually preserve and present a proper E39 M5 driving and ownership experience
Highlights:
• EAG Heritage M5 with three visits through our facility

‍

• Service history dating back to when the vehicle was new! 

‍

• Over 15k invested since 2020 to continually preserve and present a proper E39 M5 driving and ownership experience

‍
Overview:
‍

One thing that is a sure bet in the automotive world, is that when a new generation of a car comes along, it is bound to be faster than the outgoing example. Because of this, we tend to look at older performance cars in relative terms, thinking about their significance at the time, since after a few generations, the performance doesn’t really hold up anymore. The E39 M5 is a different story. Sure, a current G90 M5 would be showing an E39 its taillights in a drag race, yet there is almost no chance the G90 will ever have an opportunity to dethrone the E39 M5 as the “Greatest Ever Sports Sedan.” A combination of factors play into this, coming out in the late 1990s, the cars are fitted with enough technology to work properly and offer plenty of creature comforts, yet all of the driver’s aids are entirely defeatable, meaning you can truly exploit the perfect weight distribution and neutral chassis, built during what is arguably the era of peak BMW. Also, this M5 was the last one to be exclusively offered with a manual gearbox, ensuring that the car was only purchased new by people who loved to drive.

‍

The E39 M5’s legend looms large in the automotive world, and it is hard to find an enthusiast who doesn’t love them. At EAG, we have had countless E39s come through our hands, from ultra-low mile examples, to more driver-quality cars, and each one is an absolute joy to be around. Although it may seem like there are a bunch of E39 M5s out there, in truth, less than 10,000 came to the United States over the 4 years of production, and that number shrinks dramatically when you factor in colors other than silver and cars without deep 6-figure mileage. If you have always wanted to experience the wonder that is an E39 M5, or if you bought one new and regret letting it go, this example will bring you right back to 2002 and the car that truly epitomized BMW’s slogan at the time, “The Ultimate Driving Machine.”
History: EAG first had the opportunity to know this vehicle in 2020 when it had 60k miles. It was clear then this was responsibly owned with service history and mechanical condition. Since then we've continued to invest in this vehicle both maintaining and enhancing its condition. These services included full brake replacement to reset that baseline, all fluids and filters, power steering servotronic motor, and all of the known EAG Extra Mile services. This vehicle will receive yet another EAG Inspection to ensure this truly is a turn-key ready to enjoy E39 M5.

Listing thumbnail features:
• E39 M5 Dinan Signature S Package! 

• Late model example in perfect color combination

• Only owned in Texas and California
Highlights:
• E39 M5 Dinan Signature S Package! 

‍

• Late model example in perfect color combination

‍

• Only owned in Texas and California

‍
Overview:
At EAG, we think that the E39 M5 may be the ultimate sport sedan of all time. Although BMW has built some cars that are faster, more nimble and more luxurious inside, there was something about this car that made everything just gel perfectly. This is a great example for someone who wants to see what all the fuss is about with this chassis and can appreciate.

Powering this M5 is the famed S62 V8- a true masterpiece of engineering. With 4.9 liters of displacement, this engine produces 394 horsepower and 369 lb-ft of torque and offers instant throttle response thanks to 8 individual throttle bodies and double VANOS variable valve timing. In all E39 M5s, this power is sent through a 6-speed Getrag manual gearbox with a reinforced clutch to the rear wheels via a shortened 3.15:1 limited-slip rear differential. On this car’s trip through our shop in 2020, we added a few performance upgrades to this example that add a bit of power and make for a properly enjoyable driving experience. A Dinan cold air intake was fitted, along with some Dinan performance software to take advantage of the freer breathing. Additionally, a BMW short throw shifter was fitted to the Getrag box which, especially when paired with the ZHP shift knob, makes the gearbox so much fun to use.

The sports sedan formula has evolved significantly since the earliest incarnations in the 1950s. Moving from small and nimble vehicles built to take on tight European mountain roads to the 200+ mph autobahn luxury vehicles being produced today. Although the method may have changed along the way, the ethos is still the same: take something that looks like an otherwise ordinary family car and inject a dose of excitement into it. For decades, BMW has been at the forefront of this segment, and when they introduced the E39 M5 in 1998, many enthusiasts will tell you that they perfected the formula. Combining timeless exterior design with a running gear that allowed it to beat up on purpose-built sports cars, the E39 M5 is regarded by many to be the ultimate sports sedan.
History:
This specific E39 M5 is a new arrival to EAG and right away we went to work making it a turn-key example and future Signature Vehicle. Finding a late model version of the E39, in this spec, at this mileage is incredibly rare. When you couple that with the fact it's been a TX and CA vehicle its whole life the position to preserve this vehicle is a must.

The previous owner and client knew this was a special vehicle and enhanced it properly with Dinan components. This now is what we call a Signature S Package so it has the intake, exhaust, front strut brace, and rear sway bar all upgraded from Dinan. The combination of these parts allows for a more visceral experience without any compromise. In order to ensure that enjoyment can be had at anytime EAG has completed its Comprehensive Inspection and will be performing several services to make this turn-key, anytime. These services include a full fluid and filter change, fan clutch replacement, belt tensioner replacement, oil pan solenoid o-rings, upper control and toe arm replacement. front thrust rod bushings and an alignment to accompany all of the suspension refresh.

With 4.9 liters of displacement, this engine produces 394 horsepower and 369 lb-ft of torque and offers instant throttle response thanks to 8 individual throttle bodies and double VANOS variable valve timing. In all E39 M5s, this power is sent through a 6-speed Getrag manual gearbox with a reinforced clutch to the rear wheels via a shortened 3.15:1 limited-slip rear differential. Overview:
*EAG Heritage Vehicle - New Arrival* Carbon Black over Black Sport Leather last model production E39 M5 with only 54,801 miles!

‍

The E39 M5 chassis is turning 25 years old this year, and even today, it remains the sports sedan that every modern sedan is measured against. That is just one of the many reasons that we at EAG are fans of this chassis, we always try to find great examples, and this one is, without a shadow of a doubt, one of the best anywhere. In an era where BMW’s slogan was “The Ultimate Driving Machine,” the E39 M5 seems tailor-made to fit that phrase.

‍

Powering this M5 is the aforementioned S62 V8- a true masterpiece of engineering. The 4.9-liter engine produces 394 horsepower and 369 lb-ft of torque thanks to 8 individual throttle bodies and double VANOS variable valve timing. As the first V8 BMW M car, the E39 offered seamless performance anywhere in the powerband. Whereas some of BMW’s previous M cars required the driver to wring them out to extract real-world performance, the E39 M5 offers effortless speed in any gear, at any revs. The only available gearbox for this M5 was a 6-speed Getrag manual, which sent power to the rear wheels through a limited-slip differential. In period, these M5s were clocked as running from 0-60 mph in 4.8 seconds and on to an electronically limited top speed of 155- although it has been said with the limiter removed, they are easily capable of more than 185 mph.
History:
This M5 started its life in California where it was enthusiast owned and serviced until 2016 when it was purchased by another enthusiast. They owned the vehicle until we purchased it for the first time in 2018. At this time we reset the service baseline with a complete fluid and filter service, proactive clutch and rear main seal replacement, oil pan solenoid o-ring replacement, rear sway bar brackets upgraded, headlight adjusters upgraded, and installed new Michelin 4S tires based on age.

‍

Now in 2025 we're excited to offer this EAG Heritage M5 once again! We've performed our comprehensive inspection and will be completing another baseline reset so the next owner is able to indulge in the E39 M5 experience unhindered from any immediate service requirements. Services we're performing include fan clutch replacement, oil pan gasket along with oil and filter service, front thrust rod bushing replacement, rear toe-arm replacement, front sway bar end link replacement, and an alignment to ensure everything is to factory specification. We're also performing our Extra Mile services specific to the E39 platform that includes everything from seat twist repair to everyone's favorite front cupholder replacement.

‍

‍

This M5 also comes with full service documentation dating back to its original in-service date and will be provided to the next owner to carry the torch of this always cared for E39!

Listing thumbnail features:
‍• 5-Time EAG Signature Car

• Choice Dinan Upgrades

• Low mileage rare E39 M5!
Highlights:
‍• Rare Color Combination, Showing Just 10,806 Miles

‍

• Dinan Cold Air Intake, Stage 1 Software, Exhaust and Strut Brace

‍

• An Exceptional Example of BMW's Famed Super Sedan
Overview:
At EAG, we love to find low-mile, factory fresh examples of BMW M’s best cars. There is something special about getting into a car that is more than 20 years old, and has fewer miles than most original owners put on in their first year of ownership. What we enjoy even more than finding these cars, is when old favorites come back under our care and we can tell that the caretaker we sent the car to appreciates the originality as much as we do. 

‍

This 2003 BMW E39 M5 is a five-time EAG Signature Car, and we are absolutely thrilled to have the chance to handle this car once again. Finished in a rare shade of Bluewater over a two-tone Black and Silverstone leather interior, this car shows just 10,806 miles at the time of cataloging. First making its way through our workshop more than 10 years ago in February of 2015, the car at that time showed 7,530 miles - even with the additional time and 3,300 miles, the car is nearly identical and looks as good as we remember. Sold new in Massachusetts, the first two owners added just 5,000 miles over the car’s initial 12 years. It is clear from early on that every caretaker in this car’s history appreciated how unique an opportunity this car represented, and drove it sparingly, with some adding just over 100 miles over their years of ownership. 

‍

As you would expect, the overall condition of the interior and exterior is immaculate. The paint is blemish-free, and the Shadowchrome wheels retain their original, difficult-to-replicate finish. Although this is a very original car, a few minor modifications are noticeable both in and out of the car. At the rear, a set of polished Dinan exhaust tips can be seen sticking out of the rear diffuser, and on the inside, a ZHP shift knob has been installed as has a perforated leather steering wheel rim. The Black and Silverstone leather interior is punctuated by Euro Black trim on the center console, dashboard, and door cards, which was installed by EAG in 2016.

‍

Powering this M5 is the famed S62 V8- a true masterpiece of engineering. With 4.9 liters of displacement, this engine produces 394 horsepower and 369 lb-ft of torque and offers instant throttle response thanks to 8 individual throttle bodies and double VANOS variable valve timing. In all E39 M5s, this power is sent through a 6-speed Getrag manual gearbox with a reinforced clutch to the rear wheels via a shortened 3.15:1 limited-slip rear differential. Under EAG’s care in 2016, some minor Dinan modifications were fitted that we enjoy adding to E39 M5s. First, we installed their Stage 1 Performance Software, which was then paired with their cold air intake and freer flowing exhaust. This was then topped with an engine-bay strut brace to help tighten things up a bit. Some people may take issue with engine modifications on such an original car, but we have found these Dinan bits enhance the character of the car, rather than altering it, making it more fun to drive while maintaining essentially OEM levels of quality and reliability. 

‍
History:
This EAG Signature E39 M5 epitomizes the preservation ethos that runs through all of our departments! This example first arrived to us a decade ago in 2015 when it had 7,530 miles and complete service history dating back to its ///M break-in service in 2003. At that time we performed a complete fluid and filter service along with any seals that were aged and may cause concerns in the future. It then came back to our facility in 2016 for upgrades! It received the European black interior trim, Dinan intake, exhaust, software, front strut brace, rear sway bar, and a Bluetooth retrofit. In 2018 it returned for a full fluid service and inspection that uncovered this vehicle was continually owned by an enthusiast. This M5 then arrived in 2020 where it received fresh fluids along with all the power steering lines getting replaced to avoid any issues in that area.

‍

This legendary M5 is now back, fully serviced and available for the next enthusiast to carry its torch! 

‍

The paint is blemish-free, and the Shadowchrome wheels retain their original, difficult-to-replicate finish. Although this is a very original car, a few minor modifications are noticeable both in and out of the car. At the rear, a set of polished Dinan exhaust tips can be seen sticking out of the rear diffuser, and on the inside, a ZHP shift knob has been installed as has a perforated leather steering wheel rim. The Black and Silverstone leather interior is punctuated by Euro Black trim on the center console, dashboard, and door cards, which was installed by EAG in 2016.‍Powering this M5 is the famed S62 V8- a true masterpiece of engineering. With 4.9 liters of displacement, this engine produces 394 horsepower and 369 lb-ft of torque and offers instant throttle response thanks to 8 individual throttle bodies and double VANOS variable valve timing. In all E39 M5s, this power is sent through a 6-speed Getrag manual gearbox with a reinforced clutch to the rear wheels via a shortened 3.15:1 limited-slip rear differential. Under EAG’s care in 2016, some minor Dinan modifications were fitted that we enjoy adding to E39 M5s. First, we installed their Stage 1 Performance Software, which was then paired with their cold air intake and freer flowing exhaust. This was then topped with an engine-bay strut brace to help tighten things up a bit. Some people may take issue with engine modifications on such an original car, but we have found these Dinan bits enhance the character of the car, rather than altering it, making it more fun to drive while maintaining essentially OEM levels of quality and reliability.

Listing thumbnail features:
‍• One-Owner Enthusiast Owned! 

• Extensive service history since new

• Highly desirable and elegant color combination
Highlights:
‍• One-Owner Enthusiast Owned! 

‍

• Extensive service history since new

‍

• Highly desirable and elegant color combination

‍
Overview:
When the E39 M5 was unveiled at the 1998 Geneva Motor Show, it represented a sea change for the model and signified the M5’s evolution into a proper Autobahn missel. For the first time in BMW M’s history, the M5 was powered by a motorsport-derived V8 called the S62, which was connected to a 6-speed manual transmission. Although the E39 M5 was only 100 lbs heavier than the outgoing E34, it felt like a far more developed product thanks to its luxurious and thoroughly modern interior accommodations. When the car went on sale in late 1998, it immediately became the default choice for the well-heeled enthusiast looking for the perfect car to drive every day to the office but also take for a rip in the backroads on the weekend.

Powering this M5 is the aforementioned S62 V8- a true masterpiece of engineering. The 4.9-liter engine produces 394 horsepower and 369 lb-ft of torque thanks to 8 individual throttle bodies and double VANOS variable valve timing. As the first V8 BMW M car, the E39 offered seamless performance anywhere in the powerband. Whereas some of BMW’s previous M cars required the driver to wring them out to extract real-world performance, the E39 M5 offers effortless speed in any gear, at any revs. The only available gearbox for this M5 was a 6-speed Getrag manual, which sent power to the rear wheels through a limited-slip differential. In period, these M5s were clocked as running from 0-60 mph in 4.8 seconds and on to an electronically limited top speed of 155- although it has been said with the limiter removed, they are easily capable of more than 185 mph.

The E39 M5 chassis is turning 25 years old this year, and even today, it remains the sports sedan that every modern sedan is measured against. That is just one of the many reasons that we at EAG are fans of this chassis, we always try to find great examples, and this one is, without a shadow of a doubt, one of the best anywhere. In an era where BMW’s slogan was “The Ultimate Driving Machine,” the E39 M5 seems tailor-made to fit that phrase.
History:
We are incredibly excited to be offering this one-owner example and see it land in another true enthusiast's home! We have over 60 pages of routine service documents and provenance that started when this vehicle was new 22 years ago. We have performed our very comprehensive inspection on this example and will be performing all services needed to offer this as a need nothing turn-key example. These include complete fluid and filter service along with spark plug replacement, proactive starter motor replacement, upgraded headlight adjusters, engine belt replacement based on time, and of course all of the EAG Extra Mile services from adjusting the parking brake to replacing the center AC vent due to the stardard flap break that occurs over time.

This is going to be the perfect spec for someone looking to experience the E39 M5 without fear of mileage or upcoming services!

Listing thumbnail features:
• Excellent Low Mile Example

• Fully Loaded From the Factory

• The Epitome of BMW's N/A Inline-6 Development
Highlights:
• Excellent Low Mile Example

‍

• Fully Loaded From the Factory

‍

• The Epitome of BMW's N/A Inline-6 Development

‍
Overview: For many performance car manufacturers, there is one style of engine that they are most closely tied to; for Porsche, it is a Flat-6, with Ferrari a V12, and for BMW, since the 1930s, that motor has been the Inline-6. As technology advanced, the engine was improved and refined with every subsequent generation, and at numerous points, an inline-6 powered nearly every car in the brand’s lineup. When people talk about the peak of BMW’s inline-6 development, the S54 developed for the E46 M3 comes up frequently. A supremely flexible engine, the S54 offers fantastic in-town usability, but when you get on it, it will rev to the stratosphere and both sound and feel like a race car while you’re doing it.
History:
Built in June 2003, this E46 M3 is finished in Alpine White III over a black leather interior and shows just 25,655 miles from new. This marks the first trip through Enthusiast Auto Group for this M3, and just like all of our cars, it was subject to a thorough rejuvenation through our shop, with a bill totaling over $7,500. When this car arrived at our workshop, it was already in very good condition, with the majority of the exterior work consisting of a thorough detailing and replacing some faded badges. Although this is not a Competition package car, it sits on a set of BMW’s coveted 19” Competition pack wheels, which perfectly complement this extraordinary vehicle.

‍

While under our care, we performed our standard list of checks, including inspecting the VANOS, rear subframe, and multi-point mechanical inspection during the course of carrying out a II Service. We noticed a few minor leaks, which led to replacing a radiator hose, the constant pressure valve, and a timing chain sealing ring, and we also carried out a 4-wheel alignment. After our rejuvenation process, this 22-year-old M3 feels showroom fresh and runs and drives as it should.

Listing thumbnail features:
• The coveted ZHP Performance Package

• 6-Speed Manual

• Fully Rejuvenated by EAG
Highlights:
• The coveted ZHP Performance Package

‍

• 6-Speed Manual

‍

• Fully Rejuvenated by EAG 

‍
Overview:
The E46 platform expanding on BMW's performance and luxury ethos in a very big way when compared to the previous models. It ushered in a timeless design, multiple models to choose from, an M variant once again touting individual throttle bodies, but for many enthusiasts it struck a cord with its Performance Package 330. For those who know, they know, and we're excited to share some information on three letters that started a Mafia and the most popular shift knob BMW ever produced. The E46 ZHP.

‍

Available in all the models (minus the touring much to all enthusiast's dismay) it was the option you checked if you were looking to indulge in the performance aspects of the E46 without diving into the Motorsport offerings. The ZHP has subtle upgrades galore that include upgrades cams, shorter final drive, and higher redline. It also had the option for alcantara steering wheel, parking brake, and shift knob boot. The latter being one of the most iconic shift knob based on its functionality with heavy weight and design that still finds its way into modern manual transmission BMWs. The interior differences didn't end there though with the instrument cluster donning red needles and specific to the ZHP black cube trim on the dash that extends to the door panels no matter if it was a coupe or sedan.

‍

The exterior was also fitted with a more aggressive front and rear bumper as well as Style 135 wheels. It was a perfect blend of little things that add up to an incredible package. It was BMW showcasing it was listening to the reasonable enthusiast. It was, and is, for those not taking the racetrack to work but always opting for the backroads.

‍
History:
This properly optioned ZHP is a new arrival for EAG! It came to us from a true enthusiast with service history dating all the way back to 2006. It continually received all of the maintenance required following the old school mentality. EAG performed its Comprehensive Inspection and subsequently serviced as well as upgraded common service concerns. These services include valve cover gasket, oil filter housing gasket, both ABS pressure sensors, power steering pressure line, engine drive belts, proactive cooling system overhaul, rear axle seals, rear differential cover and mount, and new Michelin Pilot 4S tires. We also rejuvenated its appearance with a headliner recondition, all of the cloth pillar covers, steering wheel trim, and all of the soft touch plastic components. Over $17k invested into this example! 

‍

We are proud to offer this always cared for ZHP and now fully rejuvenated example as an opportunity to relive an analog experience only found 20 years ago.

‍• EAG Heritage E46 M3!

Highlights:
‍• EAG Heritage E46 M3! 

‍

• Timeless Mystic Blue over Grey color combination

‍

• Low Milage Enthusiast Owned Manual Example

‍
Overview:
For many performance car manufacturers, there is one style of engine that they are most closely tied to; for Porsche, it is a Flat-6, with Ferrari a V12, and for BMW, since the 1930s, that motor has been the Inline-6. As technology advanced, the engine was improved and refined with every subsequent generation, and at numerous points, an inline-6 powered nearly every car in the brand’s lineup. When people talk about the peak of BMW’s inline-6 development, the S54 developed for the E46 M3 comes up frequently. A supremely flexible engine, the S54 offers fantastic in-town usability, but when you get on it, it will rev to the stratosphere and both sound and feel like a race car while you’re doing it.

‍

Built in November 2003, this E46 M3 is finished in Mystic Blue over Grey Leather and shows just 27,147 miles from new.  When this car first arrived at our workshop in 2018, it was already in very good condition, with the majority of the exterior work consisting of a thorough detailing and replacing some faded badges. Although this is not a Competition package car, it sits on a set of BMW’s coveted 19” Competition pack wheels, which perfectly complement this extraordinary vehicle.

‍

Without a doubt, the S54 found in the E46 M3 is one of the best inline-6s ever produced by BMW. With dual overhead cams, individual throttle bodies, and VANOS on the intake and exhaust cams, the S54 feels like a proper motorsport engine in the high revs, but that maintains the ability to be happily used around town as well. In this example, this is paired with a solid feeling 6-speed manual gearbox, which offers great shift action and is really the ultimate way to enjoy the sublime powerplant. While under our care, we performed our standard list of checks, including inspecting the VANOS, rear subframe, and multi-point mechanical inspection during the course of carrying out an early complete factory Inspection II Service.  After our rejuvenation process, this 22-year-old M3 feels showroom fresh and runs and drives as it should.

‍

At Enthusiast Auto Group, we have handled hundreds of E46 M3s over our 20 years in business and have quite an affinity for them. The timeless design, paired with an engine that is quintessentially BMW Motorsport, the E46 M3 transcends being considered one of the great BMWs, and should instead be seen as one of the great performance cars from any brand. Period.

‍
History:
This is an EAG Heritage E46 M3! We were first introduced to this example in 2018 where it received a baseline reset and we continued to invest in its preservation with over $20,000 worth of proactive services since. These services include everything from engine drive belts getting replaced due to age, to an A/C evaporator replacement based on a small leak that would've caused issues in the future, and the E46 rear subframe mounting point reinforcement upgrade. We have all documents ready to share with the next enthusiast ready to experience this turn-key M3! 

‍

Overview:
This is a new arrival and EAG heritage example is finished in Titanium Silver over Cinnamon interior with only 27,587 miles! 

When the E46 M3 went on sale in late 2000, it redefined the idea of a performance coupe- especially in the United States. If you know BMW history, you know the story about the US market E36 M3 and how it was significantly down on power and technology when compared to the European variants. Even still, buyers flocked to BMW dealerships to acquire the E36 M3 and showed the executives that there was a serious appetite in the United States for a high performance coupe. In light of this, when the new E46 generation went on sale, it was essentially the same car that was offered around the world. This meant that US buyers received the thrilling individual throttle body motor, dual VANOS and 6-speed manual that were all held back with the E36.

The exterior of this vehicle is almost completely free of any blemishes. It truly shows like it did back when new and behind the glass walls of BMW dealerships. The interior retains its factory matte finish with vibrant cinnamon leather as a remarkable contrast to the rest of the black panels and trim. This M3 does have the 19" wheels directly from the Competition Package and are Genuine directly from BMW.

‍

Undoubtedly, the S54 found in the E46 M3 is one of the best inline-6s ever produced by BMW. With dual overhead cams, individual throttle bodies, and VANOS on the intake and exhaust cams, the S54 feels like a proper motorsport engine in the high revs, but that maintains the ability to be happily used around town as well. When paired with a solid-feeling 6-speed manual gearbox, offering great shift action, this really is the ultimate way to enjoy the M3’s sublime powerplant. While under our care, we performed our standard list of checks, including inspecting the VANOS, rear subframe, and multi-point mechanical inspection while carrying out our rejuvenation.

‍
History: We first were introduced to this M3 in 2019 and we performed a complete baseline reset service at that time. These services included an early Inspection II service with valve adjust and full VANOS inspection. We also upgraded all of the known items on the E46/S54 platform like timing chain tensioner seal, constant pressure valve o-ring, and rear trailing arm bushings. Since first sending this M3 through our service facility we've invested over $14,000 in its preservation ensuring it offers a pure ownership experience. We will be performing yet another inspection and subsequent service ensuring this is a turn-key example for the next enthusiast owner!

Overview:
For many performance car manufacturers, there is one style of engine that they are most closely tied to; for Porsche, it is a Flat-6, with Ferrari a V12, and for BMW, since the 1930s, that motor has been the Inline-6.
