A supremely flexible engine, the S54 offers fantastic in-town usability, but when you get on it, it will rev to the stratosphere and both sound and feel like a race car while you’re doing it.

This example was built in April 2004 and began its enthusiast owned journey in New Hampshire where it spent its life until we sourced back in 2012. Since then we've continued to preserve it and offer it to enthusiasts who appreciate the rarity of finding a stock LSB late model M3. The exterior of the vehicle shows incredibly well for the mileage and age with very minimal blemishes. This level of quality is followed into the interior where the Grey leather is free of any staining, creases, or wear. The satin finish is still in tact and it's easy to feel like you've been transported back to 2004 when you're behind the wheel.

Without a doubt, the S54 found in the E46 M3 is one of the best inline-6s ever produced by BMW. With dual overhead cams, individual throttle bodies, and VANOS on the intake and exhaust cams, the S54 feels like a proper motorsport engine in the high revs, but that maintains the ability to be happily used around town as well. In this example, this is paired with a solid feeling 6-speed manual gearbox, which offers great shift action and is really the ultimate way to enjoy the sublime powerplant.
History: EAG first received this vehicle in 2012 when it had 62,858 miles on the clock. Since then we've invested over $20,000 preserving this iconic example. These services include all of the E46 items you'd expect at this mileage like VANOS rebuild and rear subframe reinforcement. Prior to it being under our care this M3 was always serviced on time and at the proper mileage including a factory Inspection I at 30k and several subsequent Inspection II services at EAG. These services since new are all documented and saved with the vehicle. We will be performing yet another full inspection now in 2025 and services to ensure this is a turn-key example will be performed so the next owner only has to worry about enjoying this special M3!

Highlights:
•Reference-Grade Example

‍

• Stunningly Preserved Throughout

‍

•A Well Specified LCI E46 M3
Overview:
This 2005 BMW M3 was sold new in March of 2005 and has been under the care of two enthusiast driven owners from new. Finished in Silver Gray, this car shows a truly remarkable 6,088 miles at the time of cataloging and has been kept in exceptional condition throughout. Silver Gray is an outstanding color for this car and should not be confused with the lighter Titanium Silver that is more common. This darker gray has some blue hues to it, and much like Porsche’s GT Silver, picks up the curves in a very dramatic way. This car is fitted with the M3’s standard 18” wheels with a Chrome Shadow finish- people frequently swapped these out for larger 19” optional wheels, but these are a perfect size for the car and make for a nice sidewall that is typically missing on other M3s.

We performed our comprehensive inspection and will be performing the following services to ensure this vehicle will arrive to its next enthusiast owner running as well as it presents cosmetically. Early Inspection I service with valve adjust in conjunction with a VANOS rebuild and supplemental fluid services so everything is new and refreshed. We will also be replacing the oil pan gasket based on the gasket's age and current seep that is forming commonly found on the S54. We will also be upgrading known components like the CPV (constant pressure valve) o-ring with a Viton material as well as RTAB (rear trailing arm bushings) with Powerflex's urethane bushings. All standard EAG Extra Mile services will ensure we have the opportunity to enhance the E46 M3 delivery process almost 20 years later.
History:
It should come as no surprise that the interior is just as perfect as the exterior of the car. The black leather seats are free of any wrinkles or creases, and the black steering wheel retains its beautiful matte finish, with the red and blue M-color thread as vivid as the day it was installed. Stainless Steel trim was optioned on the dashboard, center console and door handles which provides a nice contrast against the black leather and keeps the interior looking modern and clean. It is difficult to describe the quality of the inside of this car, and even photos don’t do it justice- if you want to feel like you are stepping into a time capsule back to 2005, just slide behind the wheel of this car.

‍

Undoubtedly, the S54 found in the E46 M3 is one of the best inline-6s ever produced by BMW. With dual overhead cams, individual throttle bodies, and VANOS on the intake and exhaust cams, the S54 feels like a proper motorsport engine in the high revs, but that maintains the ability to be happily used around town as well. This example is paired with a solid-feeling 6-speed manual gearbox, which offers great shift action and is really the ultimate way to enjoy the sublime powerplant. While under our care, we performed our standard list of checks, including inspecting the VANOS, rear subframe, and multi-point mechanical inspection.

Period.
History: This is an amazing example of preservation at its finest. With over $20,000 invested in the last 5 years we're confident this will satisfy all enthusiasts. It started its journey in Washington where it stayed with the original owner until we first acquired it in 2021. During this time we performed all of our standard E46 M3 Inspection items including the VANOS and rear subframe. Services rendered include a full BMW Inspection II service, DSC pressure sensors getting replaced during its brake fluid flush, engine drive belts being replaced due to age, power steering pressure line replacement, and upgraded rear trailing arm bushings along with an alignment. After it left our facility it received a complete PPF install so everything on the exterior is covered and then ceramic coating was also applied. We will be sending this M3 through another round of inspections ensuring it is ready for its next fortunate owner. Please reach out for a complete showcase of this vehicle's service history!
CarsForSale Description: New Arrival EAG Heritage E46 M3 in Titanium Silver! ‍For many performance car manufacturers, there is one style of engine that they are most closely tied to; for Porsche, it is a Flat-6, with Ferrari a V12, and for BMW, since the 1930s, that motor has been the Inline-6. As technology advanced, the engine was improved and refined with every subsequent generation, and at numerous points, an inline-6 powered nearly every car in the brand’s lineup. When people talk about the peak of BMW’s inline-6 development, the S54 developed for the E46 M3 comes up frequently. A supremely flexible engine, the S54 offers fantastic in-town usability, but when you get on it, it will rev to the stratosphere and both sound and feel like a race car while you’re doing it. At Enthusiast Auto Group, we have handled hundreds of E46 M3s over our 20 years in business and have quite an affinity for them. The timeless design, paired with an engine that is quintessentially BMW Motorsport, the E46 M3 transcends being considered one of the great BMWs, and should instead be seen as one of the great performance cars from any brand. Period.

Listing thumbnail features:
‍• Gorgeous Low Mile Example

• LCI Updates

• Classic Color Combination
Highlights:
‍• Wonderfully Original Throughout

‍

• Sought-After Competition Pack With a Manual

‍

• The E46 M3 Everyone Wants!
Overview:
If you grew up learning to love cars through video games in the early 2000s, chances are good that when somebody brings up BMW, the first car that comes to your mind is the E46 M3. A feature in pretty much every racing game of the time, the E46 M3 may not have been the fastest car in the game, but thanks to its powerful inline-6 and balanced handling, it could take on cars that were faster on paper and still win. Unlike many things in video games, this was also true in real life, which is why the E46 has become a truly beloved car among the new generation of car collectors. 

‍

This 2005 BMW M3 is finished in Titanium Silver Metallic over a black leather interior, and shows just 38,753 miles at the time of cataloging. On top of the low miles and late production, this M3 was equipped from the factory with the sought-after Competition Package. Coming from the second-to-last model year for the E46 M3, this car benefits from all the desirable LCI modifications, including LED rear lights and updated Xenon headlamps, which look stunning when paired with the 19-inch Competition wheels. 

‍

On the inside, the black leather interior shows negligible signs of wear and is fairly uniquely optioned. Up front, the sport seats are both heated and manually adjustable - a rare combination that reduces complexity and cuts a bit of weight from the car. The trim is outfitted with patterned aluminum that gives the cabin a nice, updated feel and works well with the exterior finish. As a Competition, the 3-spoke steering wheel is wrapped in Alcantara and has just a single button on it to switch it into M Track Mode with higher limits for the stability and traction control. 

‍

Under the hood, this car is powered by BMW’s legendary S54 inline-6, which produces 333 horsepower and 269 lb-ft of torque. This is then connected to a 6-speed manual gearbox, which sends power to the rear wheels via a limited-slip differential. Under the car, the Competition Package gives the car stiffer springs, larger front brake discs, and most importantly, a quicker steering rack that livens up the handling and makes the drive even more involving. 

‍
History: The binder of service history for this car is still being reviewed.

Listing thumbnail features:
• 4-Time EAG Veteran

• A True God-Tier E46 M3 Specification

• Benefits From Some Dinan Modifications
Highlights:
• 4-Time EAG Veteran

‍

• A True God-Tier E46 M3 Specification

‍

• Benefits From Some Dinan Modifications

‍
Overview:
This 2005 BMW M3 is one of the most desirable specifications for this already special car. Finished in Alpine White III over a Cinnamon leather interior, this car was fitted from the factory with the desirable Competition Package and shows just 29,000 miles at the time of cataloging. No stranger to us at EAG, this M3 is on its fourth trip through our shop and is coming out of the collection of a great customer in the greater Minneapolis area. As a factory Competition Pack car, this M3 is fitted with the desirable 19” Competition wheels and the slightly lower suspension, which gives the car a perfect stance and makes it just that little bit more responsive in fast driving. Additionally, numerous period-correct Dinan modifications were added, many of which are no longer available. 

‍

The interior of this M3 may be the most exciting part. There are a few BMW interior colors that get enthusiasts excited, and Cinnamon on the E46 may be at the top of that list. A deep, almost orangey tan, this rich leather was rarely selected in the period, but it looks absolutely stunning today. This leather is paired with a brushed aluminum finish on the dash and door cards, which provides great contrast and is in keeping with the sporty look. With the Competition Package, the standard multi-function steering wheel is replaced with an Alcantara-wrapped unit that features just one button on the right spoke to put the car into Sport mode. The interior is almost entirely stock but, to match the Alcantara steering wheel, both the shift boot and e-break handle have been wrapped in the material. Also, a weighted ZHP shift knob was installed- this shift knob from the limited-run E46 330i ZHP has become famous in BMW circles for its added weight and perfect feel in the palm of your hand. 

‍

Undoubtedly, the S54 found in the E46 M3 is one of the best inline-6s ever produced by BMW. With dual overhead cams, individual throttle bodies, and VANOS on the intake and exhaust cams, the S54 feels like a proper motorsport engine in the high revs, but that maintains the ability to be happily used around town as well. The Dinan modifications really took place mechancially, with the addition of a freer flowing exhaust, as well as a cold air intake with a corresponding air flow meter and software to match. This car isn’t a full-blown Dinan build but features some of the more desirable parts that enhance the character of the E46 M3, rather than change it entirely. This is then paired with a solid-feeling 6-speed manual gearbox, which offers great shift action and is really the ultimate way to enjoy the sublime powerplant. While under our care, we performed our standard list of checks, including inspecting the VANOS, rear subframe, and multi-point mechanical inspection during the course of carrying out a II Service.  

‍

For us at EAG, the E46 M3 feels the most like the successor to the first E30, with its exciting, buzzy engine and sharp handling characteristics. We are also surprised that more of these cars weren’t finished in Alpine White from the factory as it does an outstanding job of highlighting the simple, clean lines of the shape, making it still look modern today.

‍
History:
This vehicle has a lot of history with EAG starting in 2015! At that time we performed an early Inspection II service along with brake and coolant flush to refresh all fluids. We also upgraded the rear trailing arm bushings and reconditioned the rear bumper. It then went to a new enthusiast's home where it stayed until 2019 and we had the ability to go round two with rejuvenation.

In 2019 we performed our all fluid and filter service as well as updated the DME and replaced age related items like battery and C-pillars. Afterwards in 2022 we once again refreshed the fluids but also upgraded the CPV o-ring, replaced the A/C drive belt along with a recharge, and made the vehicle as new as possible with our EAG extra mile services. We know the importance of delivering what BMW ///M envisioned as a final product no matter the years separated from production, so we go the Extra Mile to make sure the next owner has the opportunity to indulge.

Listing thumbnail features:
‍• Hyper low-mileage and preserved example! 

• Last model year competition spec M3

• A true time capsule for the E46 era
Highlights:
‍• Hyper low-mileage and preserved example! 

‍

• Last model year competition spec M3

‍

• A true time capsule for the E46 era
Overview:
New Arrival Alpine White/Black Leather ZCP M3 with only 2,657 miles - We're incredibly excited to offer this time capsule for the very first time! 

‍

The E46 platform is for many enthusiasts the model that harkens back to when the enthusiasm for BMW ///M started to take over. The modern introduction to a high-strung performance that felt as comfortable at the track as it did commuting to work. An engine that begged for revs so its six individual throttle bodies could naturally breath while VANOS controlled both the intake and exhaust cams so the trip from idle to 8,000 RPMs was smooth and consistent every time. A factory installed limited-slip differential allowing neutral and progressive oversteer situations. Suspension was bespoke for the ///M3 and engineered through the mechanical processes as opposed to giving that task to computers. When you think of the analog driving experience these are the just some of the ingredients used to create the perfect dish.

‍

The design of the M3 allowed it to elegantly stand out against other models and has certainly stood the test of time. Between the extended arches, side gills, front and rear bumpers, and iconic quad exhaust tips you knew you were near something special. Everything came together in a timeless package that continues to be appreciated twenty years after its inception.

‍

This example encapsulates all of those things and will allow its new owner indulge unhindered by time. The factory smell is a time machine back to the dealership. The matte finish of the leather components are still present and supple as if it was built yesterday. The soft touch trim is removed from any flaking or deterioration of any kind. It is truly an example that provides an experience as BMW intended back in 2006.
History: At EAG we understand the importance of service and maintenance no matter the miles on the odometer. This Canadian Spec M3 ZCP has been serviced frequently throughout its life with service records dating back to when it was new and will receive a full EAG Inspection ensuring all proactive services are completed prior to delivery. We are committed to providing a turn-key time capsule with this special M3!

Listing thumbnail features:
• The last of the prestigious NA powered M5

• Low mileage one-owner example! 

• Fully rejuvenated by EAG with over 15k invested and opportunity to experience the S85
Highlights:
• The last of the prestigious NA powered M5

‍

• Low mileage one-owner example! 

‍

• Fully rejuvenated by EAG and opportunity to experience the S85

‍
Overview:
It’s never easy to follow a legend. When your precursor is known as “the greatest sports sedan ever produced,” it leaves some big shoes to fill. That was the situation the E60 M5 found itself in upon its debut in 2003. The simple, classic E39 styling was replaced by styling that was largely misunderstood initially, being criticized for its over-styling and slightly odd rear end. What people didn’t realize at the time was that BMW’s innovative new design language would set the tone for countless other manufacturers in the future, and now, 20 years later, the E60 M5 is looked upon as a classically good-looking car. In many ways, the E60 epitomizes BMW in this era where they were finding massive success in nearly every segment, and was a moonshot car for them with an interior that offered incredible luxury, and an engine that was like nothing ever put in a production car- let alone an executive sedan.

‍

The true masterpiece of the E60 M5 is the V10 -known as the S85-that sits under the hood. This was one of the very few times in BMW M history, they developed an engine that was not based on any other engine in the brand’s stable. This all-alloy 90-degree 5.0 liter V10 is fitted with four valves per cylinder and individual throttle bodies, producing 500 horsepower at 7,750 rpm and 384 lb-ft of torque at 6,100 rpm. Although BMW claimed a 0-60 mph time of 4.7 seconds, Car and Driver were able to make the run in 4.2 seconds, with 100 mph coming up in just 9.4 and BMW’s electronically limited 155 mph top end was actually more like 190 mph when the limiter was removed. This engine sends power through a 7-speed SMG III single-clutch automated manual gearbox with paddle shifters. The E60 was the first M5 offered with anything other than a 3-pedal manual, but the choice made sense given the car’s expanding appeal among executives and those looking to use the car as a daily driver. Although this gearbox is happy trundling around town, operating much like a standard automatic, shifts could be dialed in on the center console, swapping gears in a staggering 65 milliseconds in full-on track mode.
History:
We were thrilled when this one-owner E60 M5 showed up as a new arrival and we wasted no time sending it through our full rejuvenation program! It was dealer serviced all of its life, owned responsibly, and it shows! 

EAG has completed its comprehensive vehicle inspection and performed serval services to ensure this vehicle is turn-key example of the V10 powered M5. Those services include oil and brake fluid services, both valve cover gaskets replaced, upper coolant hose along with the temperature sensor, front thrust rod bushings, rear upper toe arms, rear control arms, and the common seat motors were replaced. It also received our full EAG Extra Mile services where steering wheel trim was replaced along with entrance sill plates and other items you'd expect to show its age after almost 20 years. We're thrilled to be offering this example of the last NA M5!

Listing thumbnail features:
• Back for a third trip through the EAG workshop

• Elegant Color Combination

• Perhaps BMW M's most underrated driver's car
Highlights:
• Back for a third trip through the EAG workshop

‍

• Elegant Color Combination

‍

• Perhaps BMW M's most underrated driver's car

‍
Overview:
Built in October 2006, this 2007 BMW Z4 M Roadster is finished in Sepang Bronze Metallic over Light Sepang Bronze leather interior and shows 16,431 miles at the time of cataloging. This is the third time this Z4 M Roadster has come through our hands at EAG, and it is an excellent example of the model. First sold through Newbold Toyota/BMW of O’Fallon, Illinois, this car remained under the care of its first owner until 2014. The combination of Sepang Bronze Metallic paint with Light Sepang Bronze leather interior is exceptionally rare, with an estimated 39 out of the 3,042 Z4 M Roadsters finished in this colorway. That number shrinks even further when you factor in the Dark Beige canvas soft top, which was rarely selected on the Z4 M Roadster.

‍

The Light Sepang Bronze leather interior is accented by Madeira wood on the dashboard and center console. This combination gives the interior a very upscale feel that wasn’t really offered in the Z3 Ms and feels closer in style to the E60 M5 than it does a small sports car. That being said, the Z4 M was produced just before large screens and i-Drive became the norm in BMWs, leaving this car with a simple radio and HVAC setup and a pair of hooded gauges in front of the 3-spoke steering wheel. The overall condition of the interior is excellent, with no perceptible wear shown throughout the cabin. 

‍

Situated under the hood of the Z4 M Roadster is BMW’s famed S54 inline-6, which in North American trim is rated at 330 horsepower and 262 lb-ft of torque. Power is sent through a ZF 6-speed manual gearbox and to the rear wheels through a limited-slip differential taken from the E46 M3. Whereas the Z3 M Coupe and Roadster leaned heavily on standard Z3 suspension components, the Z4 Ms took advantage of the E46 M3’s parts bin to turn this car into an even more impressive performer. The rear subframe, sway bar mounts and wheel bearings were all E46 M3 and the front lower control arms are upgraded units from the E46 M3 Competition

‍

At EAG, we think that both the Z4 M in Roadster and Coupe form are underrated performers that offer pure driving enjoyment in a perfectly sized package. Only produced between 2006 and 2008, there are about half as many Z4 Ms as there are Z3Ms, and when you begin to divide them out into colors, some of them become legitimately rare cars.
History:
We've owned and had the fortune of servicing this incredible example since 2016 and supported its owners ever since.

This EAG Heritage example received an EAG Comprehensive Inspection back in 2016 when we had the pleasure of offering it for the first time. We preformed a low-mileage Inspection II service to reset the baseline for any maintenance needs along side a brake fluid flush and coolant flush. During the Inspection II we inspected the VANOS and it passed all tests. In 2017 we performed its annual oil and filter service for its new owner. When we received the vehicle back in 2022 we again performed a complete fluid and filter service along with a new battery, power steering pressure line, and rear differential pinion seal replacement.

Now that it's back for its new owner it will receive another inspection and all services will be performed so its owner receives an EAG Heritage example of a Z4M Roadster.

Listing thumbnail features:
• Unique Imola Red Over Imola Red Color Combination

• Highly Original Example

• One of BMW's Most Underrated M Cars! 

‍
Highlights:
• Unique Imola Red Over Imola Red Color Combination

‍

• Highly Original Example

‍

• One of BMW's Most Underrated M Cars! 

‍
Overview:
We absolutely love both the E85 and E86 platform, especially when paired with the beloved S54 powerplant. This was the last product from BMW ///M where you fully experienced their intentions. There was no option for the transmission; manual 6-speed only. There weren’t any suspension settings to toggle. Even things like the steering wheel were bespoke and not an option from the factory. The combination of no compromise from BMW ///M and the unmistakable seating position sitting above the rear axle make this an experience vehicle. One that can bogart the whole day with driving without a destination.

‍

Only 3,042 M Roadsters were produced between 2006 – 2008 and this is a very rear spec thanks to its color combination and lack of navigation. It’s also equipped with the Premium and Cold Weather package from BMW allowing for heated seats with memory along with headlight washer system. There are no modifications done and vehicle remains 100% stock.The condition of this example will impress any enthusiast and is fully sorted as a turnkey M Roadster ready to enjoy immediately on day one of ownership.
History:
This M Roadster started its enthusiast journey and resided in West Virgina until 2014. It then called South Carolina home until it first arrived at Enthusiast Auto Group in 2020 with 19,000 miles. We reset the service baseline at this time by performing: Early Inspection II Service with Valve Adjustment, Complete VANOS inspection, Brake Fluid Flush, Coolant Flush, Replacement Michelin 4S tires based on the tires being original to the car but still measuring like new, a four-wheel alignment, and upgraded the CPV o-ring along with all the EAG extra mile services.

We found this special M Roadster an amazing new home to a full-blown enthusiast and advocate for the BMW ///M brand. It wasn’t his first EAG M car and looked amazing next to his Limerock. During his ownership it was meticulously cared for and driven responsibly. Recently we were reacquainted with this M Roadster as it received a rejuvenation service since it was nearing 40k miles. These services completed in 2024 included: Another full Inspection II service with valve adjustment, brake and coolant flushes, proactive water pump and expansion tank replacement, new Michelin 4S tires with four-wheel alignment, rear coil spring replacement, interior headliner replacement, and more EAG extra mile services.

Listing thumbnail features:
‍• Ultra Low Mile Example

• One Owner and Long Time EAG Client

• An Exceptional Z4 M Coupe with Service History
Highlights:
‍• One Owner From New

‍

• Collector Quality Example

‍

• Ultra Low Miles With Just Over 500 Miles Added in the Last Ten Years
Overview:
After gaining significant enthusiast-cred with the skunkworks developed Z3 Coupe, when BMW unveiled the Z3 replacement, the Z4, it came as little surprise that a coupe was just around the corner. The fixed roof car provided exceptional levels of torsional rigidity and offered a larger cargo area for improved practicality. Of course, with that extra stiff chassis, BMW’s Motorsport department was excited to get their hands on a Z4 Coupe, and at the 2006 Geneva Motor Show, they presented the production ready version. Weighing less than 40 lbs more than the Z4 M Roadster, the coupe was built for driving enthusiasts and has become quite sought-after in recent years. 

‍

This 2007 BMW Z4 M Coupe is an exceptional example that has been under the care of just one owner. Delivered new to Basney Imports of South Bend, Indiana, this car shows a mere 9,932 miles and has been kept in remarkable condition throughout. Finished in Titanium Silver Metallic, the car has been serviced by the dealer from new, and received a rejuvenation by Enthusiast Auto Group in 2016. The Z4 M Coupe is differentiated from its non-M siblings by a set of quad exhaust at the rear, beautiful 18” split 5-spoke wheels, and M badging on the front fenders and rear fascia. 

‍

On the inside, the seats and door cards are wrapped in black Nappa leather, and the trim strip on the dashboard is BMW’s signature Carbon Leather which became more common with the later E9X M3. From the factory, the car was optioned with the Premium Package, which includes auto dimming mirrors, power front seats, cruise control and a premium hi-fi system. Additionally, heated front seats were ordered which is a nice thing to have for early morning drives to cars and coffee. As you would expect, the interior is nearly immaculate and shows negligible signs of wear given the ultra-low mileage on the vehicle. 

‍

Under the hood sits one of BMW’s most legendary engines - the S54 inline-6. Most commonly found in the E46 M3, this engine is even more exciting in the Z4 M, as weight is down more than 200 lbs when compared to the M3. Although power is down by 3 hp compared to the E46, the 330 horsepower in the Z4 is plenty to give the car 0-60 mph acceleration in just 5 seconds and a top speed electronically limited to 155 mph. The only gearbox available for this car was a 6-speed Getrag manual, which sends power to the rear wheels via a limited-slip differential with Variable M Differential Lock. 

‍
History: Although this is the first time EAG has offered this stunning Z4 M Coupe for sale, it isn’t the first time we have had it in our shop. Just over 500 miles ago, in October 2016, the car came to us for a comprehensive rejuvenation. During this service, most things were in excellent condition, but we did find a few significant Z4M specific items requiring service. The VANOS system did not pass all of our tests, so we rebuilt it using a Beisans kit, and the DSC hydro unit had faults stored requiring replacement to ensure the system worked properly. This big items are common in hyper low mileage M Coupes and have now been remedied the right way. While under our care, the car received a coolant and brake fluid flush, as well as our standard S54 service.

Overview: This Z4M was owned previously by a true enthusiast and easily recognized by its condition and provenance. This is BMW Motorsport telling you what they believe the vehicle should be and they were not wrong. There are no adjustable settings for anything other than the throttle response and it's mechanical engineering that provides the driving experience in true analog form. We celebrate both the coupe and roadster variants of this era because it sometimes feels like it was the swan song for driving pleasure. For those who have followed BMW we always believed The Ultimate Driving Machine will always bring Joy and this example proves to do so every time you twist the key.
History:
This M Coupe first arrived at EAG from the selling client in 2023 and received a full rejuvenation with over 25k worth of preservation services. Services that include but not limited to an Inspection II with valve adjustment documentation, updated seals for both the timing chain tensioner and pressure valve, rear shock mounts upgraded with a reinforcement plate, power steering pressure line replacement, and services that enhanced its appearance.

We appreciate all of the details at EAG and this M Coupe received all the right services to cater to the most discerning enthusiast. The headliner was reconditioned, all the window seals have been replaced, the kidney grills replaced with new from BMW, side sill entry plates replaced, fulling paint corrected and coated, items all the way to the rubber clutch pedal pad updated to remove time and mileage out of the equation to experience the last of the analog M Car.

Listing thumbnail features:
• Powered by One of BMW's Greatest Engines - the S85 V10

• Ultra-Rare US Market Only 6-Speed Manual

• BMW's Moonshot M5
Highlights:
• Powered by One of BMW's Greatest Engines - the S85 V10

‍

• Ultra-Rare US Market Only 6-Speed Manual

‍

• BMW's Moonshot M5
Overview:
This 2008 BMW M5 is finished in Black Sapphire Metallic Over Black Extended Merino Leather and has been under the care of a single owner from new. Showing just 31,874 miles at the time of cataloging, this car has been well-kept and equipped with a coveted 6-speed manual gearbox. Delivered to Westchester BMW in White Plains, NY, this E60 remains largely stock, with the only notable change from stock being the 10-spoke wheels having been painted satin black. The E60 M5 received several body updates over the standard 5-series of the era, including flared fenders front and rear with additional venting up front, a deeper front bumper, and a revised rear bumper with space for four exhaust pipes.

The interior is one of the nicest ever put into an M5- a perfect combination of luxury and sport before BMW became too screen-heavy. Wrapped in black Nappa leather, the front bucket seats are well bolstered but extremely comfortable and offer a wide range of adjustability. To break up, the black brushed stainless trim is present throughout the interior, on the dash, center console, and door cards. The center stack has buttons and dials to control the HVAC and stereo, while car settings and navigation happen on the centrally mounted i-Drive screen.

The true masterpiece of the E60 M5 is the V10 -known as the S85-that sits under the hood. This was one of the very few times in BMW M history they developed an engine that was not based on any other engine in the brand’s stable. This all-alloy 90-degree 5.0 liter V10 is fitted with four valves per cylinder and individual throttle bodies, producing 500 horsepower at 7,750 rpm and 384 lb-ft of torque at 6,100 rpm. Although BMW claimed a 0-60 mph time of 4.7 seconds, Car and Driver were able to make the run in 4.2 seconds, with 100 mph coming up in just 9.4, and BMW’s electronically limited 155 mph top end was actually more like 190 mph when the limiter was removed. This car is one of the few produced by BMW with a true 6-speed manual gearbox. Originally, BMW never intended to put a manual in this car, instead making the SMG III the only transmission available. However, after much complaining from American enthusiasts, they decided to offer a 3-pedal variant only in the US. This really enhances the driving experience while also making the car easier to own.

The E60 M5 is finally getting its due from enthusiasts who are realizing that not only is the car quite attractive, but the driving experience is second to none. The era of naturally aspirated race-derived V10s has likely passed us by and that BMW ever put this engine in a production sedan is something that should be celebrated. To experience this one-of-a-kind powerplant, connected to a manual gearbox for yourself, give us a call to check this car out.

‍
History:
This new arrival received its first EAG Comprehensive Inspection and we were very happy with the results. The services that followed were: oil and filter service, brake fluid flush along with the interior cabin filter replacement, coolant flush, engine intake air filter replacement, valve cover gaskets replaced on both banks of the engine, front thrust rod bushings replaced along with a four-wheel alignment, rear pinion seal replaced, and tires replaced with Michelin's best 4S tires.

The EAG Extra Mile services include everything to make this an example we proudly stand behind. Those services include new steering wheel trim, new kidney grills, and side gills, a thigh support motor that started to show signs of fatigue, new trunk lamp based on the clamp starting to get loose, a new security siren, and new key batteries. We know the importance of delivering what BMW ///M envisioned as a final product no matter the years separated from production, so we go the Extra Mile to make sure the next owner has the opportunity to indulge.

‍• Low mileage EAG serviced example! 

• Potent color combination for exterior, interior and soft-top

• Last model year and opportunity to experience the S54
Highlights:

‍

• Potent color combination for exterior, interior and soft-top

‍

• Last model year and opportunity to experience the S54

‍
Overview:
New arrival EAG Heritage Z4M Roadster finished in Space Grey over Black with only 17k miles! 

‍

The E85 M Roadster platform has been a favorite indulgence for all of us, especially during Summer, when you can put the top down and let the S54 sing. This example began life in California as of July of 2009 when its original owner used it for special events and always kept it serviced. Given the climate and enthusiast driven owner this vehicle is free from blemishes and mimics how it was presented when new. The interior is also free from wear in normal high traffic areas and touch points. It retains its matte finish and smells that will bring you back to the late 2000's.

‍

We often believe this is the swan song for the golden area of driver's BMW M cars. It was the last time the engineers at BMW M made a vehicle to their specification and leaned on their resolve of this is how the vehicle should feel as opposed to computers that tweak the driving experience. There is no comfort mode, the sport button only ramps up throttle response, and when you buckle in you can almost hear the glee from South Carolina if it wasn't for the S54 climbing to its stratospheric redline.

‍

Richard Hamond from Top Gear once compared this to hottest pepper in the world and it couldn't have been more apropos. You truly drive this vehicle by taking control of the wheel, the shift level, the clutch and the throttle. It all operates in harmony and when pushed you'll be forgiven for the beads of sweat and euphoric feeling!
History: We had the pleasure of first being introduced to this M Roadster from its original owner in 2014 with it only having 4,408 miles. We then sold it to a local client who enjoyed it during Summer months and continued to keep serviced. During this round of rejuvenation we together invested over $10,000 in getting the baseline completely reset and ready for its next owner. It received everything from an oil pan gasket replacement, power steering pressure line replacement, brake fluid flush, new Michelin 4S tires and all of the EAG extra mile services you'd expect.

This example began life in California as of July of 2009 when its original owner used it for special events and always kept it serviced. Listing thumbnail features:
• 1 of just 740 Built for the US Market

• Finished in the Valencia Orange Launch-Spec

• Excluisvely built for only one model year!
Highlights:
• 1 of just 740 Built for the US Market

‍

• Finished in the Valencia Orange Launch-Spec

‍

• Excluisvely built for only one model year! 

‍
Overview:
The BMW 135i was a fun, reasonably quick coupe that was well rated when it first came out, but left a lot to be desired for the hard core enthusiast. BMW had the makings of something truly great thanks to the 1-Series’s smaller platform, short wheel base and low weight- they just needed to give it that BMW M edge. What came of this project is the 1M- a truly perfect combination of powerful turbocharged engine, short wheelbase, suspension from the E9X M3, extra wide flared fenders and a penchant for oversteer. After just a few minutes behind the wheel, you will understand why so many automotive journalists and enthusiasts use this car as the benchmark for fun driving. With a design based on the “1 Series tii Concept,” first shown at the 2007 Tokyo Motorshow, the 1M differentiates itself from a standard 135i with a set of exaggerated fender flares as well as more aggressive front and rear bumpers. Upon its debut in 2011, the car immediately received rave reviews, placing 3rd in Evo Magazine’s Car of The Year Awards, behind a 997 GT3 RS 4.0 and the new McLaren MP4-12C.

‍

This 2011 BMW 1M is finished in the launch color of Valencia Orange over black leather and Alcantara interior with orange stitching. If you want a 1M that is in essentially factory-fresh condition, this is the example for you. Showing just 14,643 miles at the time of cataloging, this car has been lovingly cared for from new and cherished as the future collectible that it is. Delivered new to Brownwood, TX, in June of 2011, this 1M car has been under the care of one owner until it arrived at EAG in March 2018 when it had 5,991 miles. Although the 1M was offered in a few different colors, Valencia Orange is by far the most iconic choice and shows off the fender flares' unique lines and revised front and rear bumpers. The inside of a BMW 1M has a strong focus on driving, and all cars are fitted with the same Black Dakota leather with orange deviated stitching throughout. Although there is a screen in the center stack, it sits far enough back on the dashboard to not be in the driver's face while still providing the information you need for the infotainment system. A simple gauge cluster with a subtle Alcantara hood houses a large tachometer and speedometer, along with a small screen to display a car’s vitals. On the multi-function steering wheel, there is an “M” button, which, when pressed, alters the parameters of the stability and traction control to allow the driver to have even more fun behind the wheel.

‍

At EAG, we agree with what the general consensus was when the 1M first came out this is not just fun for an M car; this is one of the most exciting driving cars anywhere, regardless of price. BMW only imported 740 examples of these compact rockets, and finding one in this condition isn’t an everyday occurrence. The best way to figure out why everyone raves about these cars, is to put one in your garage- and it’s hard to imagine a better example than this to do that with.
History:
We first had the honor of getting to know this car in 03/2018 with 5,991 miles on the odometer! During its first visit we reset the service baseline with a complete fluid and filter service, proactive battery replacement, DME update to BMW's latest software, and tire replacement with Michelin 4S tires due to age. We then sold the vehicle to a multiple repeat client, friend, and prominent collector out in California where it stayed in his collection until coming back for its second offering. A complete and comprehensive inspection will be performed to once again reset the service baseline and offer the E82 1M Coupe experience like it was 14 years ago! 

‍

Listing thumbnail features:
• 1 of Just 740 Built for The US

• Perfect Launch-Spec of Valencia Orange/Black

• Widely Considered Some of BMW M's Greatest Work
Highlights:
• 1 of Just 740 Built for The US

‍

• Perfect Launch-Spec of Valencia Orange/Black

‍

• Widely Considered Some of BMW M's Greatest Work
Overview:
This 2011 BMW 1M is finished in the launch color of Valencia Orange over black leather and Alcantara interior with orange stitching. If you want a 1M that is in essentially factory-fresh condition, this is the example for you. Showing just 5,158 miles at the time of cataloging, this car has been lovingly cared for from new and cherished as the future collectible that it is.

‍

The inside of a BMW 1M has a strong focus on driving. Although there is a screen in the center stack, it sits far enough back on the dashboard to not be in the driver's face, while still providing the information you need for the infotainment system. The black Dakota leather is accented throughout with orange stitching to match the exterior, and the shift boot, e-brake boot and a strip of the dashboard are all wrapped in black Alcantara with more orange stitching. Overall, the interior of the 1M is very simple, but in a positive, classic way. 

‍

Powering the 1M is a variant of the twin-turbocharged inline-6 from the contemporary Z4 sDrive35is, making it the first M-car to utilize a turbocharged 6-cylinder engine. Producing 335 horsepower and 332 lb-ft of torque in normal driving, when you are really getting after it, an additional 37 lb-ft of torque is available during “over-boost” for a few seconds at a time, bringing peak torque to 369 lb-ft. The only gearbox available in the 1M is a sweet-shifting 6-speed manual that has perfectly spaced ratios for canyon carving. Under the car, the suspension received numerous bits off of the M3, making for a car that is 2.9 inches wider up front and 1.8 inches wider in the rear- which, along with the wider tires, necessitated the car's legendary fender flares. 

‍

The 1M has already gone down as one of BMW’s greatest performance cars of the past decade, and that reputation will likely just grow going forward. Although there are plenty of new BMW cars that are faster, more comfortable, and pull better handling numbers on the skid pad, that isn’t what this car is about. The 1M is one of the last BMW cars that really lets you get in touch with what matters when you are behind the wheel—experiencing the joy of driving. 

‍
History:
This specific 1M has been serviced extensively at EAG ensuring it's ready for its new owner. These include services that started in 2018 and extend into present day. All fluids and filters replaced prior to the recommend interval from the factory, the intake charge pipe replaced based on its original design from the factory, and of course the newest offering from Michelin installed in the form of their 4S tires.

We also go the extra mile so the key batteries were replaced, an exhaust hanger that didn't quite look like it was quite up to the task long-term replaced, and the plastic cover for the trunk lid bump stop were replaced. These are things often overlooked by dealers that received these vehicles when new. We know the importance of delivering what BMW ///M envisioned as a final product no matter the years separated from production, so we go the Extra Mile to make sure the next owner has the opportunity to indulge.

Listing thumbnail features:
• Competition Package

• Single hump, manual transmission, cloth interior

• No sunroof

‍
Highlights:
• Competition Package

‍

• Single hump, manual transmission, cloth interior

‍

• No sunroof

‍
Overview:
Many enthusiasts consider the E9X generation BMW M3 to be the last true M Car. This assertion is based on the combination of naturally aspirated engine, lack of overly invasive computers and frequent optioning of a manual gearbox. But one thing that isn’t frequently talked about was the ability to order these cars without any interior LCD screens which may be one of the most important factors in the long run. As BMWs have always sat at the upper end of the car market from a price perspective - and the M3 typically being quite expensive given its size - those ordering a new BMW will frequently order it with all the latest tech gadgets. With the E9X chassis, there were numerous packages you could specify that would fit your car with a second “hump” in the dashboard that housed a screen for your navigation and many interior controls which were adjusted through the i-Drive system. Although very high tech at the time, as they age, these screens do show their age- as does any ten-plus-year-old tech product- making the so-called “single hump” cars uniquely desirable.

The interior is perhaps the most unique part of this car. Optioned with a combination of leather and cloth upholstery, this was an available option throughout the E9X model run, yet a small fraction of the production ended up with this specification. That number becomes even smaller when you factor in the single-hump dashboard - it is said that of the post-LCI E90 M3s, only 443 examples were specified without a Navigation screen. As you would expect, the interior of this car remains in fantastic condition and is completely stock from the factory.
History:
When given the opportunity to bring this into inventory we spared no expense to make this special example ready for the next owner. We invested over 14k worth of services that include valve cover gaskets, motor mounts, water pump and thermostat, VANOS solenoid, all the way to adjusting the parking brake to recreate what this example felt like leaving the dealership for the first time, but enhanced.

‍

Listing thumbnail features:
• 1 of 5 E90 M3s in Fire Orange

• Comprehensive EAG Service

• Absolutely Stunning and Unique Example
Highlights:
• 1 of 5 E90 M3s in Fire Orange

‍

• Comprehensive EAG Service

‍

• Absolutely Stunning and Unique Example
Overview:
‍

Any true BMW enthusiast knows the color Fire Orange from the E92 M3 GTS and, stateside, the E92 M3 Lime Rock Park Edition Cars. One of the most eye-catching colors on the E9X bodystyle, contrary to popular belief, it was not a color exclusively offered on these limited edition coupes. By special order only, 5 individuals ordered an E90 M3 sedan in this stunning shade and EAG has had the honor of working with a few of them over the years.
History:
This 2011 BMW E90 M3 was sold new through Northwest BMW of Owings Mills, MD, and has resided in Maryland, Southern California, and Salem, Oregon, throughout its life. Showing 84,930 miles at the time of cataloging, this Fire Orange M3 is in excellent condition and benefits from a history of main dealer servicing. This E90 is more than just a rare color, though; from the factory, it was equipped with the Competition Package and, with that, the stunning 19” wheels that come with the package and a nice 10mm suspension drop that helps it sit perfectly. Under our care, the wheels have been refinished to a beautiful silver and wrapped in a fresh set of Michelin Pilot Sport 4S tires. 

The interior is wrapped in black extended Novillo leather, and has seen a few small upgrades that really take the car to the next level. One of the signature interior elements in the E9X generation M3 is the unique Carbon Leather trim that spans the center of the dashboard. In place of that on this car sits a beautiful slab of glossy bare carbon fiber that provides a bit more contrast against the dark inside. The steering wheel is a take on the standard unit but features a flat bottom, Alcantara wrap, a blue band at the 12 o’clock position and M-color stitching holding it all together. Additionally, the car was very well equipped when new with options like Premium Package 2, the upgraded stereo system and Navigation system with i-Drive. 

Powering this E90 M3 is the legendary S65 V8 - with 4.0 liters of displacement, this 414 horsepower motor is known for its ability to rev all the way to 8,400 rpm. With 8 individual throttle bodies, the throttle response is outstanding and both the induction noise and the sound that comes out of the tailpipes is intoxicating as you wind it around the tachometer. Under EAG’s care, the car is receiving a comprehensive service, along with new valve cover gaskets, belt tensioners, and motor mounts to ensure that it drives as well as you would expect from a car of this caliber. Based on a recent Blackstone oil analysis, this engine is in very good health and all element contents are well below their accepted ranges. This example is equipped with BMW’s 7-speed DCT dual clutch gearbox that offers seamless shifts and easy two-pedal driving in traffic. Some purists may say that a 6-speed manual is the best gearbox for this car but those who have driven both know that the DCT is the perfect match for this engine.

Showing 84,930 miles at the time of cataloging, this Fire Orange M3 is in excellent condition and benefits from a history of main dealer servicing. Listing thumbnail features:
• Multi-Time EAG Vehicle

• Dinan Upgrades

• A Beautiful, Low-Mile Example
Highlights:
• 3-Time EAG Heritage Vehicle

‍

• Numerous Dinan Upgrades - Installed by EAG

‍

• Uncommon Melbourne Red E90

‍

• Appealing and Well-Optioned Spec From The Factory
Overview:
It's nearly impossible for us at EAG to choose a favorite M car - some people like the classic feel of an E28 M5 or possibility of an E30 M3, while others may prefer the astounding speed of a G80 M3 Competition or F90 M5 CS. But one car that pretty much every M enthusiast can find common ground with is the F9X generation M3. Considered by the old-school enthusiasts as the “last real” M-Car thanks to its naturally aspirated engine and individual throttle bodies, fans of the newer M cars appreciate it for its speed and offering just enough tech to still be usable in modern times, without it completely overtaking the driving experience. 

‍

This 2011 BMW E90 M3 Competition was delivered new to BMW of Dallas in Dallas, TX, and currently shows just 28,441 miles. Finished in Melbourne Red, this M3 is on its third trip through the EAG workshop and remains in exceptional condition. Ordered from the factory with the Competition Package, which gives it a great stance and the sought-after 19” split-spoke wheels. To give the car a better fitment with those wheels, in 2021, we installed a set of spacers both front and rear that just slightly push the wheels out to fill in the fenders perfectly, and we installed a new set of new Michelin All-Season 4 tires while the wheels were off. 

‍

On the inside, Black Novillo leather covers the seats, center console and door cards, and the E9X signature “Carbon Leather” interior trim was optioned on the dashboard. This car was pretty loaded from the factory with boxes like the Convenience Package, Premium Package 2, Enhanced Premium Sound, and a moonroof all fitted from the factory. As you would expect from a car of with such low mileage, the interior is nearly immaculate and still has that matte-leather look that you would have found on this car when it was new. 

‍

Powered by BMW’s famous S65 4.0-liter V8, this E90 M3 is punching out a bit more than the advertised 414 horsepower thanks to some Dinan modification we added on this car’s first visit to EAG. In 2016, when the car had just over 10,000 miles on the odometer, its new owner wanted us to add the Dinan P1 Power Pack, which includes performance engine software, a cold air intake, and a freer-flowing exhaust with black tips. This undoubtedly frees up a bit of extra power and gives the car a nicer sound, both on the induction and exhaust sides. Then, in 2021, when we installed the previously mentioned wheel spacers, we also added Dinan’s DCT software, which gives the 7-speed gearbox quicker and smoother shifts while driving fast but also makes it much nicer to use around town.

‍
History:
We have been fortunate to represent this car multiple times through its life, with its most recent trip through our rejuvenation process happening in May of 2023. It has never needed major servicing, but upon its visit in 2021, there were a number of items that were aging out, which we replaced. At this time, we replaced the rear pinion seal and the Mechatronics seal, which were both beginning to leak, and we also performed a series of services, including an oil change and brake fluid flush.

‍

Listing thumbnail features:
• Two-Time EAG Visitor

• 1 of Just 20 KA737 Frozen Black Cars

• Stunning Condition Throughout.
Highlights:
• 1 of 20 From the Second Run of Frozen Black E92s.

‍

• Stunning Red Interior Stitching.

‍

• Very Low Miles and Well Kept.

‍

• Front-End Paint Protection Film.

‍
Overview:
Upon its debut in 2007, the BMW E92 M3 quickly became one of the most beloved generations of the famed model in the company’s history. With its high-revving V8, subtly aggressive styling, and superior handling characteristics, the E92 M3 was an ideal driver's car for a world moving towards turbocharging and low-down torque. In 2010 BMW announced a new line of “Frozen” paints, a satin finish from the factory, making them one of the first mainstream manufacturers to offer such a finish. That being said, this was not available in the standard color pallet and instead, BMW rolled out a series of special edition M3s to show off these new colors. 

‍

This 2011 BMW M3 Competition Coupe is from the second run of Frozen Black M3s produced, known as the “KA737” cars which were produced in 2011. One of 20 built, all of these Frozen Black Edition cars are fitted with the Competition package, 7-speed DCT gearbox and black leather with deviated red stitching. This example was completed in May of 2011, and after landing initially in Tennessee, ended up with its first owner in Carmel, CA in October 2011. At the time of catalouging, this M3 shows just 10,027 miles and remains in exceptional conditions. On the exterior, one unique feature that isn’t often mentioned with these Frozen Black cars is that behind the black painted 19” Competition package wheels, the brake calipers have been finished in red, a feature BMW saved for special edition M3s at the time. As this Frozen paint is notoriously fragile, we have installed clear paint protection film up front in an attempt to keep the finish in outstanding condition for years to come. 

‍

On the interior, black leather covers the seats, center console, arm rests and door cards, and is accented by red deviated stitching throughout. Sitting on the ash tray in the center console is a brushed aluminum placard, denoting this as “One of Twenty” produced, which is a special thing to have in any car. These Frozen Edition cars came well equipped from the factory with desirable option packages like the Convenience Package- which equips the car with park distance control, USB connectivity, and Navigation, as well as the Premium Package II that includes features such as power folding mirrors, power adjust seats and carbon leather trim throughout the cabin. 

‍

Powering this M3 is the famed BMW S65 engine- producing 414 horsepower and 296 lb-ft of torque, the S65 is capable of revving to 8,400 RPM and produces seamless power all the way through the rev range. This engine is connected to a 7-Speed DCT gearbox with steering wheel-mounted paddle shifters. What makes this gearbox so exciting is its ability to shift with lightning-fast speed and precision while out on track but also makes driving in town easier as well. As a Competition Package equipped car, the ride height is dropped by 0.4” and the wheels are pushed out further to the corners of the vehicle thanks to their increased dimensions. Additionally, the Electronic Damping Control system and Dynamic Stability Control offer increased responsiveness and greater adjustability, allowing you to truly tune in exactly how you want the car to perform.
History:
EAG is performing a comprehensive pre-purchase inspection on this vehicle and determining what is required to bring it to our standards. Please check back for a list of work performed.

‍

‍

Listing thumbnail features:
‍• Single-Hump Cloth Interior Manual Competition Configuration!

• Previous EAG M3 and Enthusiast Owned from New

• Complete Service History
Highlights:
‍• Single-Hump Cloth Interior Manual Competition Configuration!

‍

• Previous EAG M3 and Enthusiast Owned from New

‍

• Complete Service History

‍
Overview:
The E9X generation BMW M3 represents the end of an era for BMW Motorsport. A brand that was built on high-revving, naturally aspirated engines, as production concluded on the E9X in 2013, M cars all took on forced induction. Although the new engines offered far more power, improved drivability, and increased fuel economy, there is no doubt that they lost some of the charm that made people fall in love with BMW M over its decades of building cars. But, thankfully, the naturally aspirated engine they went out on was one of the greatest powerplants ever put in a road car and will forever stand as a high point in the world of enthusiast vehicles.

‍

Powering this E92 M3 is the legendary S65 V8 - with 4.0 liters of displacement, this 414 horsepower motor is known for its ability to rev all the way to 8,400 rpm. With 8 individual throttle bodies, the throttle response is outstanding and both the induction noise and the sound that comes out of the tailpipes is intoxicating as you wind it around the tachometer. This engine is paired in this car to a 6-speed manual gearbox that makes every drive a joy and is both fun to use and easy to operate. With the Competition package, the car receives suspension upgrades in the form of a 10 mm drop and higher limits on the traction and stability control systems.
History: This enthusiast spec E92 was enthusiast ordered, owned and maintained throughout its whole life. Its 1,200 mile ///M Break-In Inspection was completed on time and has had several Blackstone tests during its subsequent oil services. EAG first received this vehicle late in 2020 and it did not take long for us to find it a new enthusiast home! While it was here we perfumed fluid and filter services, DME update along with replacement AGM battery, new Michelin 4S tires, and all of the Extra Mile services including things like the Start/Stop button getting replaced due to typical blemishes to new wipers ensuring the new owner received a turn-key example. It then traveled ~3,000 miles in five years before returning to us. Its latest service here includes engine belt tensioners getting replaced and an updated Extra Mile service package. Complete history for this example has been documented, saved, and ready to share with any interested buyer.

But, thankfully, the naturally aspirated engine they went out on was one of the greatest powerplants ever put in a road car and will forever stand as a high point in the world of enthusiast vehicles.‍ Powering this E92 M3 is the legendary S65 V8 - with 4.0 liters of displacement, this 414 horsepower motor is known for its ability to rev all the way to 8,400 rpm. With 8 individual throttle bodies, the throttle response is outstanding and both the induction noise and the sound that comes out of the tailpipes is intoxicating as you wind it around the tachometer. This engine is paired in this car to a 6-speed manual gearbox that makes every drive a joy and is both fun to use and easy to operate. With the Competition package, the car receives suspension upgrades in the form of a 10 mm drop and higher limits on the traction and stability control systems.

Listing thumbnail features:
• Absolutely Stellar Color Combination

• Numerous Additional Carbon Fiber Trim Pieces

• Comp Pack, Manual, Low Mile Unicorn!
Highlights:
• Absolutely Stellar Color Combination

‍

• Numerous Additional Carbon Fiber Trim Pieces

‍

• Comp Pack, Manual, Low Mile Unicorn!
Overview:
This 2013 E92 M3 Coupe is an absolutely stunning example, finished in Interlagos Blue and showing 17,516 miles at the time of cataloging. This M3 was fitted from the factory with the sought-after Competition Package, fitting the car with the coveted 19” Y-spoke wheels and a 10mm lower ride height, dynamic damper control suspension with three suspension modes. One often discussed feature of the E92 was the use of an exposed carbon fiber roof, installed in an effort to keep the weight off the top of the vehicle and offering a very motorsport look in the process. The carbon theme is continued with a lovely set of carbon fiber mirror caps, a carbon decklid spoiler and blacked-out kidney grilles to round the look. 

‍

The interior of the car is wrapped in Platinum Novillo extended leather upholstery. This light gray is one of the least common interior colors on the E92 generation and offers a dramatic contrast with the deep blue paint. One of the first signs of use on sporty cars like this with large seat bolsters is creases in the seat leather- this car exhibits almost none of those, and the seats, steering wheel, and center console even show a nearly matte finish as if the car were brand new. The extended leather fits the M3 with color-matched leather on the center console, door cards, and lower dash, which on this car is accented by the E9X chassis’s signature Carbon Leather along the center dashboard. 

‍

Under the hood is BMW’s famed S65 V8- a true performance jewel, this engine produces 414 horsepower and will happily rev to 8,400 rpm and sounds great doing it. Paired with a 6-speed manual gearbox, this is the true enthusiast’s choice and one of the most fun ways to enjoy this masterpiece of an engine. The Competition Package fits the M3 with revised programing for both the traction and stability control, offering higher limits and allowing for a bit more slip before the car starts bringing you back into line.

‍

We love all M cars at EAG but the E9X generation M3 holds a special place in our hearts. Between its screaming S65 V8, neutral handling dynamics, overall comfort and just being the right size for our favorite back roads, it is no surprise collectors are already starting to seek these cars out to add to their stables.
History:
This vehicle started its journey in Houston Texas were the original owner took care and sparingly enjoyed it for almost 10 years and 16k miles until it was time to part ways. The undercarriage is spotless and shows it was never driven in poor weather and stored properly after use. EAG has performed its comprehensive inspection and will ensuring this vehicle is turn key ready to be enjoyed. These services include replacing the valve cover gaskets, install new Michelin 4S tires, common S65 engine mount replacements, rear axle seal replacement, and belt drive tensioner replacements.

This vehicle is a new arrival and we're thrilled to be offering it fully up-to-date with services. We know the importance of delivering what BMW ///M envisioned as a final product no matter the years separated from production, so we go the Extra Mile to make sure the next owner has the opportunity to indulge.

Listing thumbnail features:
• Single hump, 6 speed manual transmission

• Cloth interior

• Dinan intake

‍
Highlights:
• Single hump, 6 speed manual transmission

‍

• Cloth interior

‍

• Dinan intake

‍
Overview:
Powering the E9x generation M3 is the infamous S65 DOHC V8 which produces 414 horsepower stock and revs all the way to 8,400 rpm. As the final naturally aspirated M engine from BMW, this one made a statement. With 8 individual throttle bodies breathing from an upgraded Dinan Intake and VANOS variable valve timing on the intake and exhaust cams, the S65 is capable of providing gobs of low-end power while still revving higher than almost any other V8 on the market and making power all the way around the tachometer. In addition, it makes an outstanding noise that is low and muscly at idle but transitions to a high-pitched scream as you rev it out. This car was optioned with the very desirable 6-speed manual gearbox that offers a fantastic shift feel and puts a smile on your face every time you swap cogs. For the collectors, this is the gearbox you want.

The M3 is, without a doubt, one of BMW’s most beloved nameplates, and every time a new 3-Series debuts, enthusiasts wait with great anticipation to see what the M variant will be like. With the introduction of the E90 chassis in 2005, it was clear that BMW had a great starting point- and two years later, the company debuted what might be considered the best M3 of all time. After two generations of inline-6 powered M3s, another inline-6 would have been the natural choice for the E90. But with the E46’s S54 already touching the ceiling of what was possible for a naturally aspirated 6-cylinder, BMW pivoted to a one-generation-only V8 in the E90, which transformed the M3 from a quick car to an absolute Autobahn missile.
History:
This example has completed its comprehensive EAG Inspection identifying all services required to offer this as a turn-key example. These examples include engine belt tensioners and pulleys, engine air filter, interior cabin filters, rear differential pinion and output shaft seals replacement, and all of the EAG extra mile services. Please contact us for additional information and detailed photos showcasing the condition of the vehicle.

‍

Listing thumbnail features:
•1 of 40 Frozen Silver for the United States

•Exceptional Condition Throughout

•A Truly Stunning Special Edition
Highlights:
• One of the rarest E92 M3 Variants.

‍

• Unique Black and Palladium Extended Novillo Leather With Deviated Stitching.

‍

• Interior Carbon, Premium Package, Cold Weather Package.
Overview:
Towards the end of E90 M3 production, BMW wanted to make a few special edition cars to keep people excited about the car while they were preparing for the launch of the F80. One of the most sought-after limited-run cars from this time were those in Frozen Silver- a specially developed matte finish from BMW and one of the earliest matte finishes offered by an OEM. The Frozen Silver cars were produced in ultra limited numbers with only 40 units produced for the North American market. Along with the special paint, all of the Frozen Silver cars featured Shadowline blacked-out chrome trim, black kidney grilles, and a beautiful set of 19” M Performance wheels in black.

This 2012 Frozen Silver E92 M3 was delivered new in November of 2011 in South Carolina, and used sparingly by its first owner, racking up just 3,573 miles in four years when it received its first comprehensive service. At the time of cataloging, the car shows just 8,783 miles and is on its second trip through EAG. Along with the Frozen Silver paint and special features that come with it, this car was ordered with the Competition Package, with the stunning 19-inch split-spoke wheels - finished in black to match the rest of the exterior trim - and when paired with a 10mm suspension drop and Dynamic Damper Control that can change the car’s character at the push of a button, you wouldn’t want your M3 any other way. 

The interior is also unique for the Frozen Silver cars, consisting of Black extended Novillo leather with white deviated stitching and a stripe of Palladium Silver leather in the center of each seatback. Carbon fiber encases the central dash trim, the lower center console, and lower door trim, and unique chequered flag kickplates have also been fitted. The steering wheel is Alcantara wrapped, and the hand brake lever is stitched with “M Power” and features the Motorsport division’s tri-color stripes. 

Powered by BMW’s famous 4.0-liter S65 V8, the E92 M3 produces 414 horsepower and 298 lb-ft of torque and is known for its truly remarkable 8,250 rpm redline. On this car, the engine is paired to a 7-speed DCT gearbox, which offers lightning-fast shifting and is a joy to drive around town.
History: When this car first came to us in 2020, it showed 7,777 miles, and we went through it with a fine-toothed comb. As you can imagine, with so few miles, there was very little that needed doing, but we noticed a few minor leaks and seeps beginning and addressed all of those before they became a larger concern. This included removing the transmission to replace the Mechatronics sealing sleeve and the rear pinion seal on the differential. We also performed our usual EAG inspections and gave the car a comprehensive detail both inside and out, and installed a new battery.
CarsForSale Description: This 2012 Frozen Silver E92 M3 was delivered new in November of 2011 in South Carolina, and used sparingly by its first owner, racking up just 3,573 miles in four years when it received its first comprehensive service. At the time of cataloging, the car shows just 8,783 miles and is on its second trip through EAG. Along with the Frozen Silver paint and special features that come with it, this car was ordered with the Competition Package, with the stunning 19-inch split-spoke wheels - finished in black to match the rest of the exterior trim - and when paired with a 10mm suspension drop and Dynamic Damper Control that can change the car’s character at the push of a button, you wouldn’t want your M3 any other way. ‍The interior is also unique for the Frozen Silver cars, consisting of Black extended Novillo leather with white deviated stitching and a stripe of Palladium Silver leather in the center of each seatback. Carbon fiber encases the central dash trim, the lower center console, and lower door trim, and unique chequered flag kickplates have also been fitted. The steering wheel is Alcantara wrapped, and the hand brake lever is stitched with “M Power” and features the Motorsport division’s tri-color stripes. ‍ Powered by BMW’s famous 4.0-liter S65 V8, the E92 M3 produces 414 horsepower and 298 lb-ft of torque and is known for its truly remarkable 8,250 rpm redline. On this car, the engine is paired to a 7-speed DCT gearbox, which offers lightning-fast shifting and is a joy to drive around town.

With 8 individual throttle bodies breathing from an upgraded Dinan Intake and VANOS variable valve timing on the intake and exhaust cams, the S65 is capable of providing gobs of low-end power while still revving higher than almost any other V8 on the market and making power all the way around the tachometer. In addition, it makes an outstanding noise that is low and muscly at idle but transitions to a high-pitched scream as you rev it out. This car was optioned with the very desirable 6-speed manual gearbox that offers a fantastic shift feel and puts a smile on your face every time you swap cogs. For the collectors, this is the gearbox you want.
History:
This example comes to us from a dear friend and owner of Avus Autosport! It was delivered and stayed as a West Coast vehicle all of its life and we recently had the opportunity to offer it. We decided to spend 10k in proactive services on what others would believe was a perfect car because of how special this spec is and will be future classic.

Services we performed will be no surprise to anyone familiar with the E9x and S65 platform. They include belt tensioners, valve cover gaskets, axle seals, and transmission reseal. This coupled with new Michelin 4S tires, a recharged AC system, and all of EAG's extra mile services ensuring this arrives ready to be enjoyed.

Listing thumbnail features:
• Unique Cloth and Leather Interior

• Final-Year Competition Pack E92

• Alcantara Wrapped Steering Wheel

‍

‍
Highlights:
• Unique Cloth and Leather Interior

‍

• Final-Year Competition Pack E92

‍

• Alcantara Wrapped Steering Wheel

‍
Overview:
This 2013 E92 M3 is finished in Space Gray over Black Leather/Cloth and shows 25,281 miles at the time of cataloging. Fitted with the Competition Package from the factory, this M3 was delivered new to New York and has been under the care of 5 owners from new. As a Competition Package car, this M3 is fitted with the exceptionally sought-after 19” Y-Spoke wheels, and the suspension receives a 10mm drop, giving the car a great stance. A carbon fiber rear decklid spoiler has been fitted to this car, which perfectly matches the carbon fiber roof panel, a signature element of the E92 M3. 

‍

The interior is perhaps the most unique part of this car. A combination of leather and cloth upholstery was an available option throughout the E9X model run, yet only a small fraction of the production ended up with this specification. This example is fitted with an almost OEM-looking flat-bottom steering wheel that is wrapped in Alcantara, with a light blue stripe at the 12 o’clock position. Additionally, a ZHP shift knob has been fitted, which is weighted and gives positive shift action and is a welcome upgrade on pretty much any BMW. 

‍

Powering the E90 generation M3 is the infamous S65 DOHC V8, which produces 414 horsepower and revs all the way to 8,400 rpm. As BMW's final naturally aspirated M engine, this one made a statement. With 8 individual throttle bodies and VANOS variable valve timing on the intake and exhaust cams, the S65 is capable of providing gobs of low-end power while still revving higher than almost any other V8 on the market and making power around the tachometer. This engine sends power through a 6-speed manual gearbox to the rear wheels, which is really the best way to enjoy the E92 M3. 

‍

It is no secret that EAG loves the E9X generation M3s. Both the Coupes and Sedans are fantastic cars, and it is hard to choose a favorite. That being said, any Competition Package, manual gearbox equipped car with a partial-cloth interior is a big-time winner in our book. 

‍
History: We were incredibly excited to see this new to us arrive given the spec! We performed our full EAG inspection and did find a minor leak at the transmission cooler lines. This was addressed along with ensuring all maintenance was up to date and the vehicle was ready to be enjoyed. Service records indicate this was owned by enthusiasts from the very beginning and look forward to it finding its next lucky owner!

Listing thumbnail features:
• Rare Melbourne Red Exterior

• Beautiful BBS CH-R Wheels

• Ultra Low Miles With a Manual!
Highlights:
• Rare Melbourne Red Exterior

‍

• Beautiful BBS CH-R Wheels

‍

• Ultra Low Miles With a Manual! 

‍
Overview:
This 2013 BMW E92 M3 was built in 2013- the final year of production, and shows just 14,300 miles at the time of cataloging. Finished in Melbourne Red, the car is in exceptional condition and presents as nearly new. Although this car remains almost entirely stock, the owner did install a set of beautiful gray-center 19” BBS CH-R lightweight wheels, which are wrapped in Michelin Pilot Sport 4S tires. Not only do these wheels look great, but they are significantly lighter than the stock setup, improving handling and steering feel thanks to the reduced unsprung weight. One hallmark of the E90 M3 was the beautiful exposed carbon fiber roof panel which brings the center of gravity down and plays to the car’s motorsport heritage. 

‍

The interior is wrapped in black, extended Novillo leather, which encases the seats, lower dash, center console, and door cards. The two front seats are exceptionally comfortable for long drives but offer fantastic bolstering for when the road gets twisty. In front of the driver sits a classic BMW M gauge cluster with all of the necessary information and a tachometer with BMW’s signature movable redline as the car begins to warm up. The “Carbon Leather” trim has also been optioned, which is another unique E9X chassis feature that fits patterned leather across the central strip of the dashboard. As you would expect on a low-mile car such as this one, the interior is in exceptional condition, with barely any wear noted on the seats, bolsters, or steering wheel. 

‍

Powering the E90 generation M3 is the infamous S65 DOHC V8 which produces 414 horsepower and revs all the way to 8,400 rpm. As the final naturally aspirated M engine from BMW, this one made a statement. With 8 individual throttle bodies and VANOS variable valve timing on the intake and exhaust cams, the S65 is capable of providing gobs of low-end power while still revving higher than almost any other V8 on the market and making power all the way around the tachometer. In addition, it makes an outstanding noise that is low and muscley at idle but transitions to a high-pitched scream as you rev it out- especially true on this example with a Dinan carbon fiber cold air intake that adds some serious amplification to the induction. This car was optioned with the very desirable 6-speed manual gearbox that offers a fantastic shift feel and puts a smile on your face every time you swap cogs. For the collectors, this is the gearbox you want. 

‍

Not only was this the only M3 ever produced with a V8, but the V8 that BMW developed for this car was uniquely spectacular. When you consider that this gem of an engine was also the final naturally aspirated car to ever come out of BMW’s M, it is no wonder that the E9X chassis M3 sits high on many people’s lists for a future collectible.
History:
Upon arriving at EAG, we sent this E92 through our series of checks, going over the engine, all rubber gaskets and seals and giving the suspension a comprehensive check to ensure it runs and drives like a new car!
